86016.name: Characters By Level
86016.description:
From publisher blurb:

This design kit is not a replacement for the character creation rules in 4th edition. It doesn’t tell you how to set ability scores, for instance, or explain race and class features. What it does do, however, is assemble templates of the statistics that change with rising character level and does most of the math for you!

Instead of creating a 1st-level character and then adding the level upgrades until you reach the desired level, you can simply grab a template and follow the guidelines to create a character at the level you need -- making the process much faster for GMs and players alike.

86017.name: Kinectimals
videogameversion: North American Xbox 360 Limited Collector's edition
videogamehonor: 2011 British Academy Game Awards Best Family/Children's Game of the Year Nominee
2011 British Academy Game Awards Best Technical Direction of the Year Nominee
86017.description:
User Summary:

Kinectimals is a launch title for the Xbox 360’s motion control peripheral the Kinect. The game, at its surface, is a pet simulator, but Kinectimals’ gameplay separates itself from other pet simulators by utilizing the Kinect’s unique capabilities. The player interacts with one of over 20 wild cat cubs, and can name, train, and play with them in a controller-less environment.

Features:

Name your Pet – On of the first interactions the player has with their cub is naming it. After a short while the cat will start responding to their name, placing a bond between player and animal.

Training – The Kinectimals can be trained to perform a number of tricks by mimicking the actions of the player: if the player jumps, rolls over, or turns around the animal will copy them. Other orders will cause the pet to respond, such as telling it to get a jump rope resulting in the cat heading off screen to retrieve it.

Explore the Island – The Kinectimals island is full of secrets and treasures to be found by you and your pet. As you wander the area, hidden items will be found that can be used to decorate your home or unlock new items and environments.

86018.name: Le Nécromancien
videogameseries: Logiciels dont VOUS êtes le héros
86018.description:
User Summary

Le Nécromancien (written by Patrick Leclercq) is a French interactive text adventure modelled after choose-your-own-adventure gamebooks like the Fighting Fantasy: the game displays a paragraph of text, the player selects his action between 2 or 3 choices, and the game continues with another paragraph.

Kothar the mercenary has received a strange letter from his friend Bathar the Red asking for his help. He travels to the city of Stragla, only to find out that Bathar is missing, the locals terrified and strange events happening. Kothar must find his friend, fight a powerful evil and escape with his life.

86019.name: Trouble in Freesboro
86019.description:
From back cover:
PORKER SQUATTERS AND BETA CHAMBERS

It's shocking how the Big Mistake completely obliterated some places while others got by relatively unscathed. Freesboro falls into the latter camp, but if Genghis Tangh has his way, life will never be the same for the mutants of Gamma Terra. Before he can turn the Beta Chamber into a weapon, you must try to eject Tangh and his forces from their hideout at MedCen Park!

This D&D Gamma World™ adventure is designed for five characters of 1st level and is the feature for D&D Game Day: D&D GAMMA WORLD. Trouble in Freesboro™ includes a full-color battle map and ready-to-play encounters.

86020.name: Keep on the Borderlands: A Season of Serpents
86020.description:
From back cover:
SOMETHING IS ROTTEN IN RESTWALL KEEP

At Restwall Keep, you've heard that fortune and glory await those bold enough to brave the dangers of the Chaos Scar, a valley carved ages ago by a fallen star. The same tales warn that this Chaos Scar draw wickedness to it. Perhaps you can help stem this tide... and gain some treasure along the way.

Keep on the Borderlands: A Season of Serpents™ (Chapter 1) is a adventure designed for five characters of 1st level for the fall and winter 2010-11 season of the D&D Encounters™ official play program. This Dungeons & Dragons™ adventure includes a full-color battle map, ready-to-play encounters, and DM information on the D&D ENcounters official play program.

86021.name: The Arian Controversy
86021.description:
The Arian Controversy: A Game of Heresy and Hilarity is a light strategy game for two players. Set in the early fourth century AD, one player takes on the role of Arius, attempting to gain support for his position that Jesus was not equal to God. The opposing player takes the role of Alexander, bishop of Alexandria, and attempts to convince the world that Jesus was equal to God. Players must move quickly around the board, spreading their message across Europe, the Middle East, and Africa.

On their turn, players draw two cards, each of which has a certain number of action points. Using one card for action points, players move around the board and lay down support cubes. The other card is stored away, to be used at the Council of Nicaea.
Players debate at the Council of Nicaea with the cards that they've put away in order to gain further support for their position.
Once all cards are discarded, the player with the most support wins, and the opposing player is labeled a heretic.
The Arian Controversy: A Game of Heresy and Hilarity brings all of the tension and name-calling of early Christian controversy to the comfort of your living room!

86022.name: Kinect Sports
videogamehonor: 2011 British Academy Game Awards Best Family/Children's Game of the Year Winner
2011 D.I.C.E. Casual Game of the Year Nominee
86022.description:
User Summary:

Kinect Sports is a launch title for the Xbox 360’s motion control peripheral the Kinect. The game brings together six sports games in one title, including bowling, boxing, track & field, ping pong, soccer, and volleyball.

Features:

Multiple ways to Play – You can play each of the games solo, with a friend, or even with a group of people locally or online. Each game mode makes full use of the Kinect device.

Full Motion Control – Each sport has a motion control system in place that accurately mimics the sport. While playing boxing, each player punches and blocks with their hands, while in volleyball the players bump the ball with their hands.

Personalized Gameplay – Everyone can play the different games with their personalized avatars.

86023.name: Kinect Joy Ride
videogamehonor: 2011 CVA Best Game Innovation of the Year Nominee
86023.description:
User Summary:

Kinect Joyride is a launch title for the Xbox 360’s motion control peripheral the Kinect. The game is a cartoony racer that is operated by using a steering motion in front of the Kinect sensor. Joyride was initially intended to be released as a free-to-play downloadable racing title for the Live Marketplace, but was changed to its current form when Project Natal was in development.

Features:

Worldwide Cooperation – Joyride has the unique feature of community tasks. Players around the world will work together to meet overall goals that unlock additional game content. Each race played will contribute to these tasks.

Exciting Races – The game includes a few different race modes, including a standard race and trick race. In the trick race the players attempt to collect items and perform the most tricks in a set time period. Both game modes are available both on- and offline.

Unique Racing Experience – The players do not control acceleration of their vehicles; they only steer and boost the karts. Boosts are activated by thrusting the hands forward, and replenished by drifting or doing tricks (twisting the body). Coins can be collected along the track, and power-ups can be used to disable opponents’ karts.

86024.name: Combat! A Military Action Game
86024.description:
From the publisher's website (and the back cover of the book)

Whether as a member of an elite special forces team, an intelligence group, tank crew, or in command of large armies, players can now bring the pulse pounding action of military conflict to their gaming table.

This game includes such topics as:

Military characters with a wide variety of jobs. Included are all the rules you need to play a variety of roles in a military campaign (from Private to Chairman of the Joint Chiefs, Special Forces to Tank Driver, and more).
Using the Action! System, players can create any character they can imagine!
Lots of related military skills, Advantages, Disadvantages.
Military equipment (including weapons, vehicles, and personal equipment used by troops in the field)
Numerous optional combat rules to allow the GM to create a more realistic or less realistic flavor to their game.
Rules for mass combat, so that a character can now take command of a unit, a ship, or an entire nation's armed forces and wage war on a global scale!
Great military graphics.
Nearly all of the text of this game is being released as Open Game Content. This is in support of the Open Game movement, and with hope that other game designers will further develop the genre.
Much, much more!




This game will also be followed up by numerous supplements that will add even more flavor and options.

The time is now to get into the game, and Report for Duty!

86025.name: Captain Jack's Gold
86025.description:
An exciting game with simple rules for wild pirates.

For hours now, you've been listening to stories from old sea dogs about daring pirates and heavily laden merchant ships that were caught in stormy waters in the Caribbean. You perked up, though, when one sailor told you about Captain Jack's legendary pirate treasure and presented you with a tempting offer: Whoever hands over the most gold coins to him will receive a map to Jack's treasure. Now it's time to board your ships, let loose the lines and set sail!

You select one of three piles with cards and uncover the highest card. These card can do it would drive out, in order to collect sails and cannons for your ship.
Because: If your ship has many sails, can you in your play course far sails and many new cards uncover. With many cannons you have better chances to capture stranger of ships. If you did not drive out card can or want, you uncover simply still one card.

A goal is to be captured it raw materials or ships and exchanged these against gold coins.

86026.name: Mörderische Dinnerparty: Totentanz auf der Titanic
86026.description:
The Setting: North Atlantic, April 14 1912. The Titanic, the largest and most luxurious ocean liner of the world makes headway through icy waters. Lord Wellington, favourite of the ladies, is on board. He has just recently bought a mysterious jewel at auction: "The Eye of Shiva" which allegedly is cursed. One night the Lord is found dead in his cabin. Did the Indian god's revenge strike him down, or was it one of his illustrious fellow travellers from 1st class?

Das Thema: Nordatlantik, 14. April 1912. Die Titanic, der größte und luxuriöseste Passagierdampfer der Welt, bahnt sich seinen Weg durch das eiskalte Wasser. An Bord ist auch Lord Wellington, Liebling der Damenwelt. Erst vor kurzem hat er ein sagenumwobenes Juwel ersteigert “ Das Auge Shivas“, auf dem angeblich ein Fluch lastet. Nun hat man den Lord tot in seiner Kabine gefunden. Hat die Rache des indischen Gottes ihn niedergestreckt? Oder war doch einer seiner illusteren Mitreisenden aus der 1. Klasse der Täter?

86027.description:
Released in october 2010.

Contains:
- Joan of Arc: she disguised herself as a man in order to be able to join in the 100-years war. In this game she is therefore able to act as other personalities.
- Count Dracula: Being one of history's most blood-thirsty rulers, Count Dracula gets extra points for killing other players.
- Robin Hood: he steals from the rich (the player with majority) and gives to the poor (himself...).
- Merlin: as a top-ranked magician the legendary Merlin is able to use his skills to manipulate the plague.

Available through:
- Essen 2010 Show * purchase of the Pied Piper expansion in the White Goblin Games booth 5-01 in Hall 5 *
86027.name: Rattus: Spiel 2010 Bonus Cards

86028.name: Incorporated Volume 1
86028.description:
Publisher blurp:
The world is changing, and the game goes on. The Five grapple in an endless, lethal deadlock; behind each fractional movement in their balance of power is an impenetrably complex web of secret deals made and broken, brutal battles won and lost, blood and wealth flowing amongst the Spires. Keep watch on the game, or be ground to ruin in its machinations.

The world is changing, and allegiances shift. Trusted allies are a blade’s width from bitter enmity; ruthless new players carve out their territory while old kingpins crumble, choking on their last breath. Keep watch on your allegiances, or face alone the knives of yesterday’s friends.

The world is changing, and the war evolves. Expert killers endlessly refine their craft in cold laboratories, grim academies, and bloodstained streets; new weapons of horrifying power are built and bought, sold and stolen. Keep watch on the war, or be numbered amongst its countless victims.

Features
The next book from Brutal Games is entitled 'Incorporated Volume 1' and is a collection of pieces which were either produced as PDFs only, available in Signs & Portents or have been written for the game but were not appropriate to the theme of existing books.


New rules for crashing vehicles, permanent wounds, martial arts, calling in backup, cyberlin psychosis and reducing the power of NPC cannon fodder.
A style generator with hundreds of clothing options, hairstyles, tatoos, quirks and oddities.
New playable corporations including BobCo and Kalari
A range of in depth missions
A selection of new NPCs
And much more....

86029.name: Hossen
86029.description: HOSSEN! is a tactical cardgame in which players each form a "Polonaise" (a dancing pair or group) using different party guests. Not all guest are compatible with each other and your Polonaise can be disrupted and extended in several ways. A winning Polonaise is always unique and because disrupting other players lines and cards is all in the game, the game requires some sharp wits. The last round always comes unexpected, making every play unique

86030.name: G1 Jockey 4
86030.description:
User summary:

G1 Jockey 4 is an exciting horse racing simulation video game. After you create your character, you start out as a rookie jockey. Your goal is to compete in a variety of thrilling races and improve your skills. Better skills means access to better racehorses which you get to breed and train yourself.

You can choose to strive for short term goals such as winning prizes and increasing your rank, or you can alternatively aim much higher and become a legend in the ranks of jockeys

You can choose how you want to progress go for short-term goals such as raising your rank and winning prizes, or aim for the top and secure your place as a horse racing legend.

86031.description:
Back of the Box: Who can bring order into the chaos of the animal paradise? Two color die games introduce children in a child-friendly manner to their first games with rules.

The game can be played in two variants "3,2,1 - collecting fun!"and "No trace of the animal".

In the first variant the animals are build up in the center of the table at the start of the game. In turn the players roll a color die and take a building block in the corresponding color. The player who gathers the most blocks wins.

In "No trace of the animal" an animal of three different colors is build for each player. Now the players try to deconstruct the animal top to bottom by rolling the correct color. The player who finishes first wins the game.
86031.name: Constructing and Piling Zoolino
boardgamefamily: HABA My Very First Games series

86032.name: aufRUHR!
86032.description:
In the strategy game aufRUHR!, the players represent mayors who compete with one another while also needing to cooperate to improve the general state of a unified Ruhrstadt and to realize the most valuable projects. The overall goal of the game: Becoming the new Paramount Mayor of a unified Ruhrstadt, and bringing together the 53 towns of the Ruhr region.

The game board is unusual in that it's an irregularly shaped jigsaw. Each player can place developments on adjacent spaces and stand for election by all the players to become temporary paramount mayor. (You cannot vote for yourself.) The successful candidate gets a paper hat to wear and can reward different sorts of developments – which might affect the election next term. Players can use bribes (which score victory points for the recipients) or the threat of scandal to induce other mayors to collaborate with them. Money takes the form of coal – as the Ruhr region contains a significant coal field.

aufRUHR! was developed as a project by architecture students at the Berlin University of Art as part of the Ruhr being the European capital of Culture 2010 and was published in a limited edition in time for Spiel 2010. (Essen is one of the cities of the Ruhr.)

86033.name: Mobbing: Reine Chefsache
86033.description:
From publisher website: Several success-oriented would-be entrepreneurs argue, suck up and lie for the highest position in the company. The 83 old boss is searching for a successor with voting majority in the supervisory board and good references. He who plays skillful and with diplomacy can prevent the other players to get the job.

The player tries to get influence on the supervisory board by playing up to 2 lobby-cards per turn to secure their support. Who has the highest lobby value at the supervisory board will get their vote. Other lobby cards can be used to strengthen one's references or ruin the references of the oponents.
At the end of the game there is a final valuation on both reference and influence on the supervisory board.

86040.description:
Koekie Loeren is an abstract strategy game for two players in which the shape of the "board" is constantly changing. The aim of the game is to surround your own cookie with the most valuable cookies while trying to leave your opponent's cookie stuck with the cookies that are worth less.

The first player who separates a group of cookies containing his own cookie from a group of cookies worth fewer points containing the opponent's cookie, wins the game.
86040.name: Koekie Loeren

86041.name: Eden Blues
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
86041.description:
User Summary

Eden Blues is an arcade adventure game designed by Patrick Dublanchet, with graphics by Catherine Vagnon and Michel Rho, and music by Philippe Ulrich. Robots have taken over the planet and gotten rid of the human population. The only survivor is held prisoner in a high security prison, his goal is to escape his cell, find a way out of the building and rescue the last woman of earth, who he hears singing somewhere in the prison every night.

The character is defined by three stats: strength, courage and vitality. Strength is used for breaking down doors, courage is used to scare the robotic guardians, and vitality is the life energy of the character. Each of these stats can be replenished by finding the appropriate item (food, drinks and coffee). Time is an important gameplay element, as some robots are only active during the day, others during the night. Players must carefully explore the prison, keeping notes on patrol routes, places where items are stored, and safe places to rest while awaiting the next day or night period.

86042.description:
A Valdora promo tile for Essen 2010

The special board is placed next to the game board. As long as it is next to the game board it can be claimed by discarding different-colored craftsman tiles. At the game end, before scoring, the player that collected the special board is allowed to take one extra turn after the last player finished his turn.
86042.name: Valdora: Special board 19

86044.name: Amélie Minuit
86044.description:
User Summary

Amélie is just about to leave her workplace whe she finds out she has forgotten an important file. It's 11 PM, the building closes at midnight, but she can't go home without the precious file. She has one hour (real time) to explore the 224 offices (spread across 9 floors), find the items she needs (her glasses, keys...), find the file and get out of the building.

Amélie Minuit is an exploration game. Players lead Amélie from room to room, searching offices, desks and file cabinets looking for the necessary items. It was Patrick Dublanchet's first game design.

86045.name: Ténèbres
86045.description:
User Summary

Ténèbres is a French fantasy text adventure modelled after choose-your-own-adventure gamebooks like the Fighting Fantasy series.

Written by Patrick Leclercq, it tells the story of a knight's quest to free a princess. The game is split in different chapters identified by the different graphics around the main text area. If the player made a bad choice and the character died, the player was sent back to the beginning of the chapter, allowing the game to be completed in only a few hours.

86047.name: Alphakhor
86047.description:
User Summary

Alphakhor is a graphical time travelling adventure. In the year 2006, a virulent plague threatens mankind with extinction, and no cure has been found. Professor Xavier Novello finds out that another outbreak of the same disease happened in 1463, and uses his new invention, a time machine, to travel back to the Middle Ages and try to find Alphakhor, the alchemist rumored to have found a cure.

The game uses pull-down menus and icons for player input. The player must first finish building the time machine, the explore 1463 France in search of the alchemist. The game is a mix of puzzles, exploration and light resource management as the character needs food, drink and money.

86048.description:
Exclusive expansion module October 2010, Essen, Spiel 2010:

The bishop presents the painters with some extraordinary scrolls. With the help of these chronicles of the elder masters, the players now can restore the fresco according to his fancies and earn extra victory points.

(from rulebook)
86048.name: Fresco: Expansion Module 7 – The Scrolls
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game Pit - Episode 29: The Expanded Expansion Special

86049.description:
Game description from the designer:

For the heroes of space lanes, Dragon Dawn Productions has something new to offer: the first expansion for its 2010 title The Phantom League called Mostly Harmless.

This expansion will include new cards for pretty much every deck (docking, improvement, battle, captain, mission, ship and hyperspace). The new cards will extend the game play of the base game and differentiate more between the path of fame and notoriety.

Mostly Harmless also includes reprints of the most "broken" cards of the original game and a new and improved English-language rulebook that covers both the expansion and the base game.
86049.name: The Phantom League: Mostly Harmless

86050.name: Fruity Frank
86050.description:
User Summary

Fruity Frank is an arcade game developed by Steve and Sean Wallis. Frank must collect fruits, while dodging or killing monsters (either by throwing a ball or pushing apples on top of them). Collecting all the fruits sends the player to the next level, with more monsters, fruits worth more points and a slightly faster game speed. There were several pieces of background music, each a computer adaptation of traditional songs like "Sweet Molly Malone" or "My bonny lies over the ocean". The music would play slower or faster depending of the speed of the level.

Fruity Frank is one of the most well-known Amstrad CPC games in France.

86051.name: Slumbering Tsar: The Temple-City of Orcus, Part I: The Tower of Weeping Sores
86051.description:
publisher blurb

Having won through the Desolation, the players find that the worst is yet to come as they discover that the Black Gates of Tsar are protected by the legendary Kirash Durgaut—the Tower of Weeping Sores. Never broken in battle, this bastion stands firm after centuries. Can it still be inhabited after all this time? Only the brave or the foolish dare find out. For 11th-level PCs, The Tower of Weeping Sores provides the spring board for the exploration of the city beyond by providing the details of The Tower of Weeping Sores as well as the Black Gates of Tsar and the Walls of Death.

86052.name: Monsteca Corral
86052.description:
User Summary

Monsteca Corral is an action-puzzle-strategy hybrid game downloadable through Wiiware. The game takes place on a faraway world where a number of different monsters (and robots) coexist in disharmony. The goal of the game is to guide a group of monsters through dangerous levels by herding them around obstacles and robots. There are a wide range of climates that the player needs to guide the monsters through, and each is filled with unique hazards that must be avoided. Monsteca Corral includes a local 4-player co-op so players can work together with their friends to successfully get the Sdompe herd to safety.

86053.name: I.Q. Games: Inventors and Inventions
86053.description: User summary: Like the other games in the "I.Q. Games" series, this game consists of a deck of cards, each card listing an "answer" (in this case Inventors and Inventions). There are 35 cards, and each card has art depicting the inventor and their invention on the front. Players take turns guessing. The "reader" starts with the first of the 5 clues. Answering correctly on the first clue gets 5 points. Each subsequent clue is 1 point less. An educational trivia game that has game-play flexibility, allowing for normal play, solo play and team play.

86054.name: Atheria (First Edition)
86054.description:
User summary:

The first official publicly released version of the Atheria RPG. There have actually three editions of the game, though the first two ("Alpha" and "Beta") were not released publicly.

86055.name: Inertie
86055.description:
User Summary

Inertie (inertia) is a French action-adventure game. The player's task is to pilot a ship through subterranean caverns to rescue stranded astronauts. The ship has a lot of inertia and require skillful piloting in order to land without crashing on the landing platforms. Once landed near an astronaut, the player takes control of the pilot and must bring him back on board before running out of oxygen. An added twist is that some astronauts are spies, and if they are picked up, the game inverts the controls. There are computers spread throughout the levels that give the names of real astronauts and spies. Once a level is cleared, the game gives a code to access the next level.

Inertie was programmed by Christophe Le Bouil, with graphics by Patrick Daher and sounds and music by Xavier Talgorn.

86056.name: The Laundry
rpghonor: 2011 ENnie for Best Art, Cover - Nominee
2011 ENnie for Best New Game - Silver Winner
86056.description:
Publisher blurb:

CAPITAL LAUNDRY SERVICES - WHAT NEEDS TO BE CLEANED UP?

There are things out there, in the weirder reaches of space-time where reality is an optional extra. Horrible things, usually with tentacles. Al-Hazred glimpsed them, John Dee summoned them, HP Lovecraft wrote about them, and Alan Turing mapped the paths from our universe to theirs. The right calculation can call up entities from other, older universes, or invoke their powers. Invisibility? Easy! Animating the dead? Trivial! Binding lesser demons to your will? Easily doable!

Opening up the way for the Great Old Ones to come through and eat our brains? Unfortunately, much too easy.

That's where the Laundry comes in - it's a branch of the British secret service, tasked to prevent hideous alien gods from wiping out all life on Earth (and more particularly, the UK). You work for the Laundry. The hours are long, the pay is sub-par, the co-workers are... interesting (in the Chinese curse sense of the word), and the bureaucracy is stifling - but you do get to wave basilisk guns and bullet wards around, and to go on challenging and exciting missions to exotic locations like quaint, legend-haunted Wigan, cursed Slough and Wolverhampton where the walls are thin.

You may even get to save the world.

Just make sure you get a receipt.

THE LAUNDRY roleplaying game is based on the award-winning Laundry series (THE ATROCITY ARCHIVES, THE JENNIFER MORGUE, THE FULLER MEMORANDUM) by the even-more-award-winning CHARLES STROSS, and uses the also-award-winning BASIC ROLEPLAYING SYSTEM (CALL OF CTHULHU).

In this book, you'll find:


Computational demonology, summoning extradimensional horrors, and three ways to use a shotgun to banish alien monsters.
A history of the Laundry and the other occult intelligence agencies
Classified briefings on known threats and monstrous horrors
Streamlined rules for character creation, investigation and combat
Three ready-to-play missions

86057.name: Super Meat Boy
videogamehonor: 2010 IGF Awards Excellence In Audio Nominee
2010 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee
2010 Spike Best Independent Game of the Year Nominee
2011 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Downloadable Game of the Year Nominee
2011 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Nominee
2016 Steam Awards Love/Hate Relationship Nominee
86057.description:
User Summary:

Fast, chaotic, and hard platform game. Features multiple homages to classic platform games and to other indie games.

rpgitemversion: Warhammer Fantasy: Guía del Jugador (Edge PDF version)
Warhammer Fantasy: Guía del Jugador (Edge version)
86058.name: Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay: Player's Guide
rpgissuearticle: Warhammer Fantasy Rollenspiel - Die Revolution des Rollenspiels?
rpgpodcastepisode: Episode 0 – Wilkommen und Was benötigt man zum Spielen?
Episode 7 – Konvertierung von 2ten zur 3ten, Währung, Geisteskrankheiten und weiteres
86058.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Player’s Guide is a hard-cover book containing all the essential information a player needs to make and play a character.

The Player’s Guide compiles all the Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay Core Set player information into one hard-cover package, including the rules, card summaries, and updated examples of play. By summarizing all the information from the career sheets, action cards, and ability cards, the Player’s Guide lets groups choose to incorporate however many components they like (including none, if that’s your preference).

86059.name: Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay: The Creature Guide
rpgissuearticle: Willkommen in der Alten Welt, Spielleiter
rpgpodcastepisode: Episode 0 – Wilkommen und Was benötigt man zum Spielen?
Episode 21 – Ressourcen für Kreaturen & Bestiarium: Bestien
86059.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Within The Creature Guide lies an expanded bestiary for Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay and many new concepts that make building encounters easier than ever! With rules on building encounters and utilising the new components found in The Creature Vault, this Guide is an invaluable tool.

Introducing dozens of new enemies and adversaries to your game, The Creature Guide gives GMs many more options for populating their stories, battles, and adventures. This comprehensive bestiary is organised alphabetically by creature category or classification (i.e. Beastmen, Greenskins), and each category contains various types of adversaries and how to use them in your game.

86060.name: Player's Vault
rpgpodcastepisode: Episode 0 – Wilkommen und Was benötigt man zum Spielen?
86060.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Player’s Vault is full of valuable resources for Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay, including 30 careers, 45 talent cards, more than 150 action cards, five party sheets, and a plenty of blank character sheets. The full colour punchboard features more than 30 player character standups, as well as the stress & fatigue tokens, tracking tokens, stance pieces, and activation tokens a player needs to manage his character during a session or over the course of a campaign.

The Player’s Vault contains all the innovative Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay components that complement the information found in the Player’s Guide. For players involved in campaigns without their own Core Set, the Player’s Vault is a perfect entry point. It provides the player with all the components needed to easily create, track, and play their characters.

86061.name: Game Master's Vault
rpgpodcastepisode: Episode 0 – Wilkommen und Was benötigt man zum Spielen?
86061.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Game Master’s Vault for Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay is packaged in a sturdy box that contains a set of basic action cards, 70 wound cards, 19 miscast cards, 30 condition cards, 30 insanity cards, 24 location cards (duplicates of 12 different locations), and 1 item card. In addition to cards, the Game Master’s Vault also contains full colour punchboard consisting of NPC/creature standups, stress/fatigue tokens, corruption tokens, a stance ring and activation token, 24 tracking tokens, 2 center puzzle fit stance pieces with 6 puzzle fit stance pieces, and 1 pre-assembled progress track that serves as a handy initiative track.

Rounding out the Game Master’s Vault is a valuable set of 12 custom WFRP dice as well as 24 plastic stands for character standups. Also in the Vault is a two-page insert that compiles a list of these components in addition to providing rules for the included materials. Game Masters who want to learn even more ways to incorporate these components in their games will find expanded rules and explanations in the Game Master’s Guide.

86062.name: The Creature Vault
rpgpodcastepisode: Episode 0 – Wilkommen und Was benötigt man zum Spielen?
86062.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Creature Vault introduces dozens of new denizens of the Old World to incorporate into your Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay campaigns. Featuring all the creatures from the WFRP Core Set and all subsequent expansions (through Signs of Faith) plus all new creatures, this Vault is an invaluable tool for building exciting encounters.

Along with The Creature Guide, The Creature Vault introduces a new format for presenting enemy stats and information. Moving this information from book to cards and sheets allows GMs to build intricate encounters quickly and easily. Group sheets contain all the rules and abilities of particular creature categories, while Creature cards present all the stats and special rules for creatures within that category. Finally, Action and Talent cards allow GMs to customize their adversaries to fit their adventures.

The Creature Guide contains 131 action cards, 105 creature stat cards, 14 creature category sheets, 3 small standups, 42 medium standups, and 13 large standups.

86063.name: Zooloretto
86063.description:
In Zooloretto each player uses small, large, wild and exotic animals and their young to try attracting as many visitors as possible to their zoo.

But be careful - the zoo must be carefully planned. Before you know it, you have too many animals and not enough room for them. That causes negative points! Luckily, you can expand your zoo.

- Use the touchscreen to drag and drop animals and vending stalls into your zoo

- Drag the "roller blind" from the top to gain an overview of your zoo and the zoos of the other players

- Unlock new player characters and future add-ons in the integrated shop

- 3D-view for zoos, animals und vending stalls

- Animations and sounds of the animals makes you feel like you are in a zoo

- Learn exciting details about all animals from the game in the encyclopedia

- Play against the computer or up to 4 other players (Pass'n Play)

Source: The Publisher Website.

Home Page & Newsletter:

www.zooloretto.com




(German and english)

86064.name: Monster Dash
86064.description:
Monster Dash is an action game starring the hero Barry Steakfries as he runs and shoots monsters with nothing to lose! Travel through portals to visit exotic world locations, battling demons, mummies, vampires and more! No monster is safe when Steakfries is on the case!

Just two buttons controls the action – jump and shoot. The action speeds up and changes gears with every new world, but thankfully there are weapon and health pickups to get Steakfries into serious action mode. Blast your enemies with the one shot Pacifier, electro-charge your way to victory with Mr. Zappy, and look out for the ultimate in raining destruction – the Machine Gun Jetpack!

Get as far as possible and shoot monsters along to way to amass high scores and collect awards. Upload your best runs to the Openfeint leaderboards, and enjoy every ounce of personality Barry Steakfries brings to your iPhone.

You’ll do the dash. You’ll do the Monster Dash.

Source: The Game Website.

86067.name: Party Time with Winnie the Pooh
86067.description:
From the box back:

Join Winnie the Pooh on an exciting adventure in search of lost treasure! You can invite your friends to join the fun - there are lots of games to play together.

Encourage your child to discover, question, observe and understand. Puzzling challenges, goal-based games, multi-level gameplay, award systems and fun-filled activites, all promote logical thinking and essential reasoning while providing house of entertainment and amusement to your child.

86068.name: G1 Jockey 4 2007
86068.description:
User summary:

G1 Jockey 4 2007 is a very realistic horse racing simulator. It is the sequel of G1 Jockey 4 and was published only in Japan.

You start out as a rookie jockey and work your way to becoming a world class champion by participating in various horse races. You get to breed and train your own horses to become future race winners.

86069.name: Tortured Souls! (Issue 3 - Mar 1984)
86069.description:
From the back cover:

This issue of Tortured Souls! contains full details of how to set up and run the Zhalindor Campaign, including the special spell effects, politics and economics of the Empire and the surrounding lands PLUS a Free colour Campaign map. Also featured are:

Galizhard: An exciting town adventure to introduce the players to the Campaign.

The Thing in the Attic: A floorplan-based scenario for AD&D or Basic, in which a simple piece of thievery is complicated by the presence of a hideous lurking menace.

The Trollball Trophy: A Runequest wilderness adventure. An aging Priest is robbed and murdered, but who would want the missing lead statue, and why?

Brohar's Bane: The demon Brohar is ready to lay waste the kingdom of Ferulian. Only your champion has the means to prevent him in this AD&D solo adventure.

86070.name: Tortured Souls! (Issue 4 - Jun 1984)
86070.description:
From the back cover:

This issue of Tortured Souls! contains exclusive details of the pantheon specially formulated for the Zhalindor Campaign, and now appearing in print for the first time ever. This unique and highly detailed system links the spell ability and worship practices of the cleric class to a particular chosen deity. Can be used with Zhalindor or other AD&D campaigns. Also featured in this issue of Tortured Souls! are the following scenarios:

Eldrahim: Zhalindor Campaign module designed to introduce the new religions supplement.

The Waterfront: A pair of floorplan-based scenarios for AD&D/Basic, featuring riotous goings-on at a seedy waterfront tavern (based on the DRAGONMEET '84 competition event)

The Tomb of the Scorpion King: A unique multi-system solo (AD&D, Expert, RQ, T&T) Deep in the heart of the Kalharza desert lies a maze-like tomb which no man may enter and live. How then can you escape with the Treasure of the Scorpion King?

86071.name: Tortured Souls! (Issue 5 - Sep 1984)
86071.description:
From the back cover:

Issue 5 of Tortured Souls! contains the following scenarios:

Gollush Glum-Drum's Mystical Garden: The party is called to the assistance of a village under attack from a small dog-headed humanoids, and traces the miscreants to a local shrine. Even seasoned veterans should be cured of kobold-bashing in the ensuing chaos of this insane floorplan-based scenario (mindless hack-and-slay in the best tradition for AD&D or Basic!)

Crypt of the Damned: A high level scenario for AD&D/Expert. Is it merely local superstition that gives the crypt its name and reputation, or is there some sinister explanation behind the recent disappearances? Includes two alternative endings endings, plus amendments for lower level play. (Can be played in 3D with a special Torchlight fantasy products dungeon pack now available)

The Black Hawk: This issue features a double-length scenario from the Zhalindor Campaign (a challenging series of independently playable pull-out modules for experienced AD&D players). A medium level party adventuring in the uncharted islands south-west of Nerria face danger from all sides. Will they be able to find the hero's tomb and obtain the help they need?

Pygmy Island: A solo role-playing adventure for complete beginners. Command a party of six adventurers, cast powerful magic spells, fight with hideous monsters and make life-or-death decisions in your quest for the legendary treasure. All you need are pencil and paper and a six-sided die to brave the perils of Pygmy Island. Includes advanced versions for AD&D/Basic.

86072.name: Patapon 3
videogamefranchise: The Best (Best Selling PlayStation Games, JP)
86072.description:
A long time ago, the Patapon Ancients fearlessly traveled in search of a land called Earthend, home to a mysterious object known as IT. Led by their god, the Mighty One, no foe or creature could stand in their way. Their adventures grew to be a legend spoken for generations. But that was the past. Now the descendants of the Patapon Ancients live in the desolate frontier, driven from their home by the evil Zigoton army. To return to their home and vanquish their enemies, they need their god to return and beat mystic drums to lead them to victory.

You are their god. You led them through the first Patapon® world, mastering six different drumbeats to command the Patapon troops to march, attack, defend, power up, retreat, and use magic.

You beat the drums of victory in Patapon® 2 with new Heroes and warriors, building an army to uncover Patapolis, an ancient place long spoken of by the Patapons.

Now they need your drums once again in Patapon® 3. Don’t let them down.

Devastate your opponents with attacks as Superhero Patapon in the third iteration of the critically acclaimed rhythm-based action adventure. Play campaign with friends, go head-to-head, or even take on a clan of other Patapon gamers with network play allowing up to eight people. Customize your tribe with different weapons and abilities in the greatest portable adventure of rhythm and war.

Source: The Game Website.

86073.description:
Publisher Description:
It should be easy to name 3 breeds of dogs - but can you do it under the pressure of 5 seconds twisting down, and with the other players staring at you, waiting for you to get flustered? Time's not on your side, so just say what comes to mind and risk ridiculous answers slipping out as time twirls down on the unique twisted timer! It's all in good fun with this fast-paced game where you have to "Just Spit It Out!"
86073.name: 5 Second Rule

86074.name: Ultimate Yahtzee
86074.description:
User summary:

Based on the Yahtzee board game and has the same basic rules and objective. Game has five modes: Classic, Battle, Triple, Painted, and Pyramid.

86075.description: Expansion to Luna Llena. Including 6 new pack cards for the Werewolf player, 3 new hexagons, a "chainsaw" special item and 15 special abilities distributed randomly to all characters at the beginning of the game for being used once in the game.
86075.name: Luna Llena: Death Moon

86076.name: Nobunaga's Ambition: Rise to Power
86076.description:
User summary:

Nobunaga's Ambition: Rise to Power is set in Japan during the 16th century within the Warring States period. You have a large number of options as to which state you will start the game from, the warlord you will choose to start with, as well as the difficulty level.

During the game you are in control of every minute detail of governing your state. You can develop and strengthen your territory, buy, sell or transfer goods, sabotage your enemies, build troops, negotiate with rival warlords, interact with your officers, wage war or repel invasions.

Immerse yourself in feudal Japanese life and experience hours upon hours of exciting strategic and tactical decisions.

86077.name: Trinity Universe
86077.description:
User summary:

Trinity Universe is an original full 3D RPG which combines elements and characters of the previous Disgaea and Atelier games, to create a new world setting.

You can take the role of either Kanata, a male Demon Dog character, or Risalea, a female Valkyrie character, thus having the chance to explore two different story lines. Improve your set of skills and attack points so that you can deliver more damage, and pay particular attention to the time limit, as it is of essence in completing the various quests.

86078.description:
This expansion will be played together with the master variant of Asara. The players who decided to choose the "House of the genie in a bottle" have one wish free.

The players have to pay the stipulated price and can then choose one action of one of the other areas.It is not important whether the other areas are free or occupied.
86078.name: Asara: Das Haus des Flaschengeistes

86079.description:
Background:
The competing city-states can barely survive on their own. Now it is possible to receive aid from Athens, which, of course, brings its own disadvantages.

Components:
Athens-Tile
2 Athens-Chips
86079.name: Peloponnes: Athens-Mini Expansion

86081.name: Pete Rose Baseball
86081.description:
From The back of the package:

"I play baseball one way... all out" Pete Rose

Here's the first 2600 Baseball game to live up to this winning attitude.
> From the crack of the bat, make split second decisions as you choose which fielder makes the play.

>Throw popular Major League pitches - fast balls, curves, change-ups, screwballs and sinkers.

> Head to head action with your friends or against the computer.

> Complete TV-like coverage, with six camera angles you're always right there where the action is.

> Play to a packed stadium complete with cheering crowd and organist. (Bring your own peanuts and hotdogs).

> The most exciting baseball ever on the 2600 with depth and feel you've seen on Big League Home Computers.

86082.name: Skate Boardin'
86082.description:
From the back of the package:

Radical moves dude! The crown freaks out as you blast by on your blazin' board... darting and slicing through the tubes and over that last killer ramp to win the "Worldwide Skateboard Champion" trophy... Rinnngggg! Bummer! Your alarm clock!! You've been dreaming again... and now there's, like, five minutes to get to school. One more time and it's suspension for you. So jump on that board and get psyched for a totally intense cruise! Sure, you're awesome - but do you have the timing? The guts? Conquering all 30 obstacles will be the ultimate challenge... and time is running out! Go for it!!!

86083.name: RuhrWeiber
86083.description:
Translation of box back:

Did you know...
which woman from the Ruhr area was the first to drive a car around the world? Why the DFB used to forbid woman soccer teams? What Tana Schanzaras real name was? Or what a "Mutterklötzchen" is?

The female side of the Ruhr area: The game invites you to rediscover the history of the Ruhr area. All aspects of women's history with women in society, art, culture, economy, politics are made accessible in a playful manner. The game offers exciting questions regarding historical and contemporary women from all social domains, introduces women's groups, highlights "female" events and opens up places connected with women.

Includes four different rules to play.

86084.description:
The Inrah box contains a set of cards similar to Tarot cards. It can be used as a roleplaying supplement (to play out card reading), but also to play Boltan which is a Poker variant. Due to the different number of suits and cards in each suit, the probabilities of hands are different from Poker, so the hand ranking was adjusted.

Translation of box back:

Inrah - the card game from the world of The Dark Eye: 121 playing cards that can be used for the Aventurian card gambling game Boltan and also for fortune-telling. 49 "Great Arcana" show themes from Aventurian mythology, 72 cards in six suits show the houses of the elements (from Ace to Seven, Squire, Knight, Prophet, Wizard and Prince). Includes booklet with interpretation hints and layouts for card reading as well as instructions for different Boltan variants.

Illustrations by Caryad and Mia Steingräber.
86084.name: Inrah

86085.name: Tembisa
86085.description:
From the back of the box: Tembisa is a unique combination between card and dice game that allows you to play three different games which are all based on Africa and its adventures.

The three different games are:
1. Tembisa, the treasure hunt
2. Tembisa, the African farms
3. Tembisa Memory

The game materials consist of 1 die, 4 wooden pawns and 56 playing cards. Besides a startcard and finishcard (showing the treasure in a cave), the cards show different situations you come across (e.g. a hungry lion, a wild river, a giant snake, friendly villagepeople). Each card also shows a negative number, STOP, or 1 or 2 dice to roll.

1. Tembisa, the treasure hunt
A line is laid out of the playing cards. All cards, except for the start and endcard are placed facedown. A player rolls the die and moves his or her pawn accordingly. If the card where the pawn ends is not face upwards yet, do it now. In either case: this card shows a picture of what you met, together with a it's effect on your pawn: move it accordingly. (The number of places shown backwards, STOP or roll 1 or 2 extra dice.) The card where pawn ends up has no further effect for that players turn.
When six uncovered cards are in a uninterrupted row, this region is deemed fully explored. Only the positive cards keep their effect.
The player to reach the endcard showing the treasure first, wins the game.

2. Tembisa, the African farms
For this variant, the start and end card are not used.
Players try to build the biggest farms. A farm is build by placing a -1 card on the table. This farm can be enlarged by placing a -2, -3, ... on top in order.
A player is allowed more than one farm, all starting with a -1.
The STOP and 1 and 2 dice cards are used for protecting and stealing cards from the other players: to attack play a stop card on anothers farm, depending on further STOP or dice cards, a dice duel commits between attacker and defender. If the attacker wins he or she robs a die roll of cards from the top of the attacked farm. These must be used immediatly to enlarge his or her owns farm(s) or be discarded.
A STOP card can also be used to protect one farm. When placed on top a farm of your own, that farm is protected against robbings. However, you cannot enlarge it anymore either.
Players hold six cards in their hands, drawing 1 extra at the start of ones turn. This can be a card from the drawpile, or the top one of the (open) discard pile.
At the end of ones turn cards are discarded or taken to fill up to 6 cards.
STOP and dice cards are removed from play once used.
Gameplay continues till there are no more cards in the discard and drawpiles. (The discardpile is reshuffled and becomes the new drawpile each time.) Then the values of the farms are added for each player, the player with the largest farm is the winner! (Just count as if each card had a positive number, instead of a negative.) Cards held in hands don't count.

3. Tembisa Memory
A variant on ye old Memory. The goal is to make pairs of cards. The STOP cards count as jokers, it can form a set with any other card. However, two STOP cards are not a set!
The 1 die and 2 dice cards are also jokers, but also give a number of bonus points at the end of the game: roll one or two dice accordingly for the number of bonus points.
Scoring: The values of the couples are counted, dice bonusses are added. Player with the most points wins the game.

86086.name: Shake Shake
86086.description:
Shake Shake is a building or stacking game with colored plastic blocks and an unstable platform to build on

Box side text [spelling errors as printed on the box]:

A new dimension of 3D Tetris Board Game!
It is a round 3 dimensional board game similar to the Tetris game. Accumulate the blocks in the 3dimensional space. It is an easy and enjoyable game for everyone.

It is a game played on a swiveling board by keeping the balance!

It is an exciting game which make the players playing with bated breath and blow away the stress with the thrilling game!

Exciting strategy game!

It is a logical and mathematical game!
The player who get more blocks of the same color wilol win the game.

86087.name: Pits of Azak-zil
rpgseries: CORS - Living Greyhawk Core Special Adventures
86087.description: From the cover: "An old dwarven mine, buried deep in the Abbor-Alz and infested with undead, holds many treasures. Most prized of these are deposits of precious metals brought by a falling star said to be purer than any other in the Flanaess. Now powerful forces struggle for control of the mines but with whom will you side? A one-round Living Greyhawk Core Special adventure set in the Bright Desert and the Abbor-Alz for characters level 1-15 (APLs 2-16)."

86088.name: Heimat-quiz
86088.description:
Translation from box leaflet:

It is very simple. 100 important questions, 100 right answers. One asks the question, the other gives the answer. Who picks the right answer from four possible choices keeps the question card. Then the next player has his turn. The one with the most cards at the end has proven himself to be a true "Niederrheiner" [Lower Rhine resident].

86089.name: Ice River Battle
86089.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your ears are met by the sound of rushing water, and you squint against the glare of reflected sunlight. The mountain river has begun its spring thaw, the frozen surface breaking up into ice floes of varying size, all being carried downstream.

With your enemy in sight, you have no choice but to venture out onto the treacherous ice, struggling for balance as you fight for your lives.

Ice River Battle is the first of Adamant Entertainment’s VENTURE 4TH line. This product features a unique setting for a combat encounter, providing full-color printable tiles usable for miniatures, as well as special rules governing the location.

86090.name: Monster Maker
86090.description:
From publisher blurb:

The monster design guidelines in the core rulebooks state openly that they’re only an approximation -- Gamers have described those rules as ‘rough’ at best and ‘crudely unbalanced’ at worst. The golden design standard of ‘N + Level’ creates inconsistent monster statistics, and in addition, the original designers themselves ignored their own guidelines most of the time, as many monster statistics presented in the core books seem arbitrarily assigned.

Monster Maker is a design kit for creating monsters in 4E. Instead of creating inconsistent and unbalanced encounters where players are repeatedly missing and getting pounded upon by foes who consistently hit and dodge incoming attacks, these optional rules are for Game Masters who want more exciting and faster-paced monsters for their players to fight.

86091.name: Pact of Blood
86091.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are primeval beings that subsist on the power inherent in blood. While many of these creatures are minor spirits that stalk the edges of life, waiting for the moment when violence or a chance accident spills the liquid they crave, others are more powerful. Specters of war, torture devils, and spirits of sacrifice, all fuel their eldritch power through blood.

Warlocks forge pacts with these entities that thrive and grow on the spilling of blood. With a simple word a Warlock can call them to feed at an enemy’s wounds, increase the strength of the Warlock's magic, or even control the blood coursing through another creature. Others fear the blood-pact warlock, for just as his patrons demand his blood in exchange for power, they also thrive on the blood of any living creature -- friend and foe alike.

This pact features a full listing of powers from Levels 1 through 30, four new Feats exclusive to the pact, a paragon path, and four new magic items.

86092.name: Pact of Ghosts
86092.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a creature dies, its soul passes beyond the realms of the living into unknown planes. However, whether from sheer tenacity, a misapprehension of their true state, or a need to finish some uncompleted business many spirits refuse to make this final journey. Mortals know these itinerant souls as ghosts -- existing in a half-world between corporeal reality and the cold, invisible realm of the dead.

Warlocks forge pacts with these spirits, and can call upon their special nature to phase through solid objects, drain foes of life energy, and torment the living with mind-blasting sounds and images.

This pact features a full listing of powers from Levels 1 through 30, four new Feats exclusive to the pact, a paragon path, and three new magic items.

86093.name: Pact of the Angelic Choirs
86093.description:
From publisher blurb:

Warlocks treat not only with the maddening fey or strange, outré powers from the void, but with astral creatures of light and strength. Known to mortals as angels, most assume these creatures are messengers and servants of benevolent deities. Some warlocks have discovered the ancient thaumaturgies and rituals used to invoke the creatures that roam the Astral Sea. These warlocks can channel life-giving power, or blast their enemies with searing light and the awesome might of the heavens.

This pact features a full listing of powers from Levels 1 through 30, two new Feats exclusive to the pact, a paragon path, and three new magic items.

86094.name: Pact of the Dragon Lords
86094.description:
From publisher blurb:

The draconic race awoke soon after the universe’s creation-- only primordials and the gods predate them. The greatest, most ancient of wyrms have passed on to the higher planes, but their essences remain, powerful life-energies that can guide and influence other beings who know how to call upon them.

Warlocks forge pacts with the primal dragons, gaining a special connection with one draconic type, but able to call upon others as well. With a simple word a Warlock can blast their enemies with deadly elements, invoke the strength and power of a rampaging dragon, and tap the race’s ancient knowledge.

This pact features a full listing of powers from Levels 1 through 30, four new Feats exclusive to the pact, two paragon paths, and four new magic items.

86095.name: Pact of the Vermin Lords
86095.description:
From publisher blurb:

Though seemingly insignificant, the sheer abundant life-force of spiders, flies, centipedes and their ilk has attracted the patronage of many powerful gods. The earliest warlocks learned these Vermin Lords granted boons not just upon their subjects, but also on anyone willing to forge a pact with them.

These warlocks can call upon the powers of arachnid, worm and insect to poison foes, sicken them with pestilence, and consume their very flesh.

This pact features a full listing of powers from Levels 1 through 30, a new Feat exclusive to the pact, a paragon path, and three new magic items.

86097.name: Abigot's Catalog of Fiendish Armor
86097.description:
From publisher blurb:

Arm yourself against the forces of Good.
Purchase or create your armor for facing the forces of good with Abigot's selection of items you can?t find anywhere else. If it's evil, you'll find it at Abigot's.

Abigot's helps you Purchase.
If you have the gold, you?ve got the access to Abigot. Whether outfitting yourself or an entire army, Abigot's will help you get the quantity and quality you demand. Unique special abilities allow you to choose and customize armor to your specifications.

Abigot's helps you Create.
If you have the spell-casting and item creation necessary, Abigot's can help you create. With each catalog listing, enough information is provided for the crafter to make his own.

Abigot's Catalog of Fiendish Armor is a 6 page pdf (3 pages of items) featuring 5 armor special abilities (one of which also works for shields), 6 specific armors, and 2 specific shields. In addition, the book features 2 new special materials to craft armor with - Flesh and Demonhide.

86098.name: ElfClash: Realm of Lanai Player's Guide
86098.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forget what you know, or think you know, about elves. They are not the fragile, merry creations they are thought to be. This book will tell you of a realm run by these ruthless races, about their vicious wars, and about the fearsome reign of evil-minded kings in a land where the true ruler is greed itself.

This player's guide is 222 pages of elf mayhem. It contains:

7 Elf Subraces. Some may be familiar, but others are unlike any elf encountered, such as the winged Skie Elves, and the Tali, a shapechanging elf. There are also variant dwarf, halfling, and human races.
10 Core Classes. These feature variant bard, cleric, druid, fighter, paladin, and ranger classes. This section also includes two alternative spellcasting classes; the Arcane and the Elementalist, utilizing two new magic systems. Finally theres the Rogue and the Scholar.
Many of the new classes utilize a variation of abilities.
A reputation system, new skills, feats, equipment, and a map of Lanai are all included.

86099.name: Fringe Campaigns: Soul Harvest
86099.description:
From publisher blurb:

The gates of Hell have opened. Fiends run rampant across the earth. As kingdoms fall, resistance comes from small groups known as Disposables. Will you survive when your world goes to Hell?

Fringe Campaigns: Soul Harvest is a sourcebook and mini-campaign setting for unleashing Hell on your campaign. Also included are 1 new class, 11 new prestige classes, 12 new feats, 18 new spells, 4 magic items, and 12 new creatures. Plus new rules for alignment, demonic abilities, and more!

86100.name: Fringe Fauna
86100.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beasts of the earth, air, and water. Not even your druid knows these creatures... yet! Need to populate a world with creatures and want it a bit alien? Want your druid or ranger to have an animal companion no one has ever seen before? Need a mount that's never been in a stable? How about a familiar that's not so familiar?

Fringe Fauna is 59 pages of brand new animals. There's no monsters here, just 50 animals that don't exist in the real world. Also included are lists for animal companions (for druids and rangers), familiars, and mounts utilizing the animals in this book. Finally, the book wraps it all up by wilderness encounter and CR. Every animal is illustrated in black and white and has a page to itself (and a few are on two).

86101.name: Aching for Blood: Mosquitofolk
86101.description:
Publisher Blurb:

There’s no such thing as too many monsters! Here Be Monsters brings new monsters and everything you need in order to use them right now in your campaign.

In this book, you’ll discover:


9 new monsters: different varieties of mosquitofolk and related creatures.
The complete ecology of the mosquitofolk.
A mosquitofolk lair with detailed color map.
3 different mini-adventures of varying levels.
And tons of hooks!


The mosquitofolk want nothing more than your blood...all of it. And they’ll stop at nothing to get it. Some of the creepiest monsters ever imagined, they are fully fleshed out and ready to spring on unsuspecting characters everywhere.

Here Be Monsters: Aching for Blood is a perfect monster resource for game masters wanting new monsters for their world or for players wanting to learn about and prepare for the world of their characters. This high quality, web-optimized pdf is compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and contains everything you need to utilize mosquitofolk in your game right now.

86102.name: Fringe Monsters: Predators of the Pit
86102.description:
From publisher blurb:

Planning your next trip into the Abyss and don't know what to expect? Is the wilderness overrun with demons? Looking for mindless carnage against new, challenging foes? Well, look no further! Demon predators presents 10 new bestial fiends straight from the Abyss with no other purpose than to eat your characters. These demons are ready to invade your game, and are also completely compatible with Fringe Campaigns: Soul Harvest.

Predators of the Pit has 15 pages (of 21) of predatory demons for your campaign of CRs 2 thru 20, and also comes with a b&w printer friendly copy. You've dealt with dangerous predators before - but are you ready to face predators of the Pit?

86103.name: Fringe Races: Rogues
86103.description:
From publisher blurb:

They're above you... they're below you... they might even be next to you.

The first book in the fringe series introduces four new races from the edge of society. The crag goblin is a flying humanoid race dwelling in the highest, most hard to reach places of the world. Darkness Dwellers are subterranean humans that exist in absolute darkness, no longer needing vision. Impets are mischievous diminutive flying fey, whose appearance hints at their devilish nature. Moon Sirens are a race of females who have been given an extended lifespan and powers over others by their goddess. Each race's favored class is rogue, and provides complete racial information for players, as well as stat blocks for DM's. The book also includes two new deities, one new domain, 11 new spells, 3 new weapons, a new poison, and 6 new magic items.

86104.name: Tank Attack! Board Game
86104.description:
A light "Wargame" played on a board made by hexagonal tiles randomly placed on the table.

The hexagons represent different kind of terrains (plains, hill and forest) and player try to conquer them in order to attack the enemy's HeadQuarter.

Players army is composed by small plastic tanks, a trademarked gaming piece by Editrice Giochi.

Combat is resolved rolling special dice.

From the box:

Tank Attack! is a strategy and conquest game. Each player has an army made of "Carrarmatini-EG" (tiny tanks), with which he will try to conquer the General Headquarters of the other players, eliminating them. The scope of the game is indeed to be the last player left in the game. Tank Attack! is played on a battlefield made of hexagons that represent the various land types which are placed on the table, always in different manner. The battlefield will be different at each game and therefore you must learn to adapt your strategy to the different game situation, exploiting at best the characteristics of the land on which the battle will take place.

86105.name: Monster Anthology: Volume 1
86105.description:
From publisher blurb:

What new foes await your characters? Are they fiends from the Lower Planes, or strange new races infiltrating the world your players once knew? Within you'll find creatures that will fit into nearly any fantasy campaign!

From our best selling supplement, Fringe Campaigns: Soul Harvest, to our early products Tremon: Kingdom of Sorcery and Fringe Races: Rogues, we've collected all of our creatures, critters, and races and bound them into one complete supplement. Inside you'll find thirty-four of our monsters -- 8 of which also include Monsterous NPCs, ready to use! Plus you'll find multiple Templets to convert end more creatures over to the Khan's Press way of gaming. All of the creatures have been updated to the 3.5 d20 edition, and many have undergone changes giving them a brand new look. GameMasters will find something for any level adventure, with CR's ranging from 1 to 50!!

Khan's Press didn't forget about the Players either. Of the 34 monsters, 9 include stats to be played as characters (including Level Adjustments). And you don't need to purchase any of Khan's Press's other releases in order to use the Anthology. All necessary rules are reprinted in the appendix (which means you also get 12 Khan's Press feats and 7 Khan's Press spells)!

rpg: Dread: The First Book of Pandemonium
86106.name: Dread: The First Book of Pandemonium
86106.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The bodies that were found were, in many cases, unrecognizable. James Yarborough, 24, a gas station attendant, had been crucified in his garage. Dennis Atwater, 39, a farmer, had been impaled on a pitchfork in his back yard. His right arm was missing, and appeared to have been twisted off. Mary Ann Walker was found in her bathtub, fully clothed, her lower jaw sliced off neatly, as if by some impossibly precise blade. Inexplicably, many of the injuries appeared to be self-inflicted.

Dread: The First Book of Pandemonium is a tabletop role-playing game of modern horror-action, set in a world of black magic and demonic possession. Originally released in 2002, the game has been streamlined and revised. Dread features 88 gut-wrenching spells, including Caliban, Bile, and Viscera, and includes 41 demons, including the seductive Laradina and the pyrokinetic Gatterag.

86107.name: Queen of Da Nile:  Mummy's Day Catalog
86107.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need an ancient relic for a d20 Modern Game? Need a new flavor for your d20 fantasy game? Just want more crunchy items to sink your teeth into?

Now you've got it. Inside you'll find 24 magic items: 10 wondrous items, 8 staffs, and 6 artifacts (each with full stats)! All of the items are directly tied to Ancient Egypt's history and religion. This product's perfect if you?re looking to begin an Egyptian inspired game or if you just want to add new items to any campaign!

86108.name: Blitzkrieg London
86108.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Spring, 1944.

The war is going very badly for the 3rd Reich and Nazi commanders decide the only hope lies in a daring raid conducted by their elite Eugenics Brigade.

The target: British and American commanders conducting planning sessions in the heart of London.

Your goal: defeat the Eugenics Brigade and protect Allied commanders, regardless of the cost.

86109.name: TankAttack: CardGame
86109.description:
A card game part of the TankAttack line of games.

Players have a hand of 5 Tank Cards showing a number of "tanks".

From a deck of States Cards one is drawn an placed in the middle of the table. This is the target for the game round. States Cards represents the 50 States of the US and every card has a value that represents aproximately the number of inhabitants of that State.

Players choose secretly a card and then show them simultaneously. The highest card wins and the player get the State Card.

A set of small tanks (a trademarked game piece by Editrice Giochi, called Carrarmatino-EG) is used to take track of the score.

The first player to reach a predetermined score is the winner

86110.name: Knowledge Arcana (Issue 7  - Fall 2006)
rpgissuearticle: Hosting a Great Game of Minis
Why Momir Magic is Mo' Fun
86110.description:
Issue 7 of Knowledge Arcana

Cover art by Lana Crooks

86111.name: Lost Cities
86111.description:
Lost Cities is the Xbox Live Arcade version of the popular card game of the same name by game designer Reiner Knizia, published by Sierra Online. The game was released on April 23, 2008 for 800 Microsoft Points (US$10); it is currently unavailable for purchase.

Source: Wikipedia, "Lost Cities (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86112.name: Spellbinder
86112.description:
Spellbinder - The Domino Word Game

An Absorbing Pastime for Children age 5-12

Complete words by adding to your opponents' dominoes. Be the cleverest 'Spellbinder' and the first to use all your pieces. A game for 2-4 players.

Source: box

86113.name: Band of Bugs
videogamehonor: 2007 IGF Awards Technical Excellence Nominee
86113.description:
The game is focused on turn-based tactical battles between groups of anthropomorphic bugs, with each player controlling a number of individual bugs. The game includes a variety of different bug types (as units), each serving in a different combat role (e.g., heavy infantry, archer, support, etc). As the title is intended to appeal to casual gamers (among others), turns are relatively quick and combats are small in scale.

In contrast to many turn-based games where either an entire side moves at once or individuals move according to some initiative value, units in Band of Bugs take turns. When sides have an equal number of units, each side moves a single unit at a time before ceding control to the other side. When one side has more units than the other, that side takes a proportionally greater number of moves at a time, e.g. two moves to every one of the opposition when one side has twice as many units as the other. The same unit may not be moved more than once per full turn, with a full turn ending after all units have acted. This system helps ensure that players do not spend an excessive amount of time waiting for their opponents to act.

Units vary in their statistics and capabilities, with most units having at least one special ability which can be used instead of a standard attack. Some bug types have multiple weapons or attack types (e.g., one ranged and one mêlée weapon) which can be switched between at the cost of an action. Lastly, some bugs can make use of magic, with various spells which can be cast a limited number of times per battle.

While there are a limited number of items which can be picked up and used at a later point in time, Band of Bugs features no significant resource management elements above and beyond troop management.

Source: Wikipedia, "Band of Bugs", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86114.name: Narosia: Sea of Tears
86114.description:
From publisher blurb:

The key elements of Narosia are to provide a fantasy setting that is both familiar and new. The familiarity is found in the common fantasy elements that have been a part of classic fantasy roleplaying for many years. This means many things to many people, but the goal is to take many of the tropes of fantasy gaming and put them into a context that makes some amount of sense.

Adventurers are a lauded professions, dungeon crawling (including traps, greater challenges based on depth, etc.) is common source of adventure, magic has influence on the economy, and the gods walk the land. This is not the extent of Narosian gameplay, but illustrates the extent of the familiar.

The uniqueness of Narosia as a setting lies in the history, the geography, and the integration of the familiar. The uniqueness of Narosia as a gaming supplement lies in focus on game utility. Every section of the material strives to present as much game-useful material as possible. Cultures, races, economy, skills, talents, perks, spellcraft, channeling, divine interaction, the good, the bad, and the ugly.

86115.name: Creature Weekly Volume 1
86115.description:
From "From the Creators:"

This is the first in a series of creature packs we are publishing on a weekly basis so players and game masters alike can bring new material to the table every session. It is our hope that Creature Weekly will have something for everyone.

Not everyone runs fantasy games, however. Rather than provide mixed–genre creatures that only work in some settings we have set out to provide you with the tools you need to quickly and easily adapt each creature for your own campaign, whether it is set in the wilds of a lost elven kingdom, in the concrete maze of a modern urban sprawl or in the cold depths of space. Check the “Variant Rules” box with each entry to help adjust game mechanics.

The “Alternate Genres” section is there to provide suggestions for adjusting the concept of each creature for non–fantasy settings.

86116.name: Inca Empire: Bonus Sun Event Cards
86116.description: A mini-expansion for Inca Empire, containing four new Sun Event Cards: Quarelling Gods, Fame, Road Planner and Earthquake.

86117.name: The Rogues Gallery (UnMet)
86117.description:
user summary

A collection of NPCs for use with Unhallowed Metropolis.

86118.name: Detective Calling
86118.description:
From publisher blurb:

Covering private investigators, consulting detectives like Sherlock Holmes to the hard-bitten police inspectors of Scotland Yard, presented for you in its entirety. Here is another way to play in the alternate world of the Darkest London that’s never been.

86119.name: Blood Legacy: The Dhampir Revisited
86119.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the interest of refining the Dhampir’s role as the premiere vampire hunter of the Neo-Victorian World, the authors have added the following Feature to the Dhampir Calling.

86120.name: Tortured Souls! (Issue 6 - Dec 1984)
86120.description:
From the back cover:

Issue 6 of Tortured Souls! contains the following scenarios:

Between Fire and Stone: Designed as an introduction to \'The Halls of the Dwarven Kings\' boxed role-playing adventure, this scenario can also be played independently. For a medium sized party of reasonably experienced player characters (any major role-playing system)

Barbarians: A supplementary guide to the organization and religious beliefs of the barbarian races. Essential background material for Zhalindor or other role-playing campaigns.

Valley of the Wyrm: A quest begins in this high level scenario from the Zhalindor Campaign (a challenging series of independently playable pull-out modules for experienced AD&D players), using the barbarian supplement detailed above. The party must brave the wastelands north of the river Zahn in their search for the hidden temple of a fabled White Dragon.

The Chelin Escapade: In the secluded valley of Chelin, concealed in a crumbling monastery of the same name, an ancient artifact awaits the arrival of the eager party. But who, or what, are the Shrouded Guardians, and why are the party here at all? A scenario with a difference!

ZOOT: (Featured Game). Dwarves meet Orcs meet Elves in "The Arena of the Golden Sphere". All you need is a six sided dace and a pack of playing cards to take pary in this fast and furious 3 player game. FREE full colour gameboard and counters inside!

86121.name: "Thanks a Lot!?"
86121.description:
The "What do your friends really want?" Game

A getaway in southern France, 24 hours of invisibility, or bring one animal back from extinction which do you want the most? Thanks A Lot.? is the lively game of giving and receiving where it’s truly the thought that counts. Dole out amazing gifts to your family and friends based on what you think they’ll like. The higher someone ranks your gift, the more points you score. (from the manufacturer)

86122.name: Orado
86122.description:
Abstract two-players-game on a leather-plan (which you can tighten to a little bag) and with semi-precious stones as counters.
Both players have 13 counters, 8 in one and 5 in another color. The board has 13 fields. During the game, the players "color" the fields with their stones, at the end every field has one of four possibilities of stone-combination.

To win, you want to create less equal color-combinations in adjacent fields than your opponent.

86123.name: Raupenralley
86123.description:
Semi-abstract two-players-game on a leather-plan (which you can tighten to a little bag) and with semi-precious stones as counters and a 4-sided-die.
Be the first who gets his 7 caterpillar-stones into the center of the apple.
