Those who find themselves unworthy of Claus’s rewards may find themselves at the mercy of a dark creature who leaves terror in his wake along with switches and coal.

For some, it is the most joyous of holidays.

For others it is the night of the Krampus.

Features:

Santa Claus and the Krampus. Two powerful demigods, Santa and the Krampus rule the winter nights. Claus is the everchanging spirit of giving and generosity, who appears differently to every species that beholds him. The Krampus is the manifestation fo vengeful punishment and greed, who not only punishes mortal children but rewards monsters for their evil deeds each winter. Ever wonder how goblins, bugbears and orcs get their hands on magic items too complex for them to create? The Krampus is to blame.




Santa and the Krampus are presented both with full gameplay stats and as standard deity writeups. Also included is a third deity writeup for Jack Frost, Santa's distant but still quite dangerous rival for control of the winter season.

New Creatures: Incarnates of Santa Claus and the Krampus stand in for their deific creators as low-level proxies. Petitioners in the service of the two holiday spirits keep the demiplane of Winter Holidays running. Snow elementals stalk the winter landscapes in search of foes to vanquish or friends to protect. Plus quick-stat adjustments for Santa's steeds, the ghosts of Christmas Past, Present and Future and the bizarre Christmas Treant.
The Realm of Winter Holidays: A new demiplane associated with Santa Claus and the Krampus, complete with random encounter tables.
Winter Holidays: Guidelines for the adaptation of real-world winter holidays and descriptions of fantasy holidays useful in any campaign setting.
Equipment: Six new magic items plus tables for holiday gifts from both Santa Claus and the Krampus.
Multi-genre Support: The scenario is provided with variant background ideas for incorporating the material into modern fantasy, modern sci-fi, post-apocalyptic and space opera campaigns to make quick adaptation easy.
Variant Rules Support: Like all Octavirate products, Octavirate Presents: Night of the Krampus provides quick-reference variant rules support for each creature and NPC including wounds/vitality, defense bonus, armor as damage reduction, modern/3.0 damage reduction, sanity loss, taint, magic rating, spell points, honor and reputation.




Night of the Krampus can serve as a one-shot adventure scenario or the backbone of a campaign or a short series of adventures. The PCs' involvement can be as simple as investigating the source of a goblin tribe's magical weapons or as large as saving the whole of Christmas/Yule/Saturnalia from the evil grip of the fiendish Krampus. Creature content and deity writeups make sure the Night of the Krampus is usable at any time of year.

86199.name: Simple Tricks and Nonsense
86199.description:
From publisher blurb:

Greetings and Well Met, Friends!

Welcome to Calrith's Catalog of Curious Conjury, the realm's only inclusive guide to simple sorcery and amateur arcane artistry. Perhaps you are merely a dabbler looking to expand your powers in bold and creative ways. You may be a mighty master of magic who seeks knowledge on how to get the most of the least of your abilities. Or you may lie somewhere in-between. Whatever your situation, whatever your profession, the spells thusly contained will be of a surprising aid in your day-to-day life, be you mage or minstrel, druid or diviner!

-Calrith Cazaaar

Features:

Fifty New Cantrips. 0-level spells for every spellcasting class and every situation. Everything from utilitarian sorcery to specialized magic. Low-level magic has always been boring and basic, but these new spells can give any caster a much needed boost at low levels.
Three new low-level spells. Calrith’s cantrip cannon unleashes multiple cantrip effects simultaneously. Calrith’s cantrip cascade gives you the long-running magical demonstrations you’ve always wanted and props and scenery is a must have for any bard.
Seven New Feats open up low level casting to any class and enhance the cantrip and orison-wielding power of devoted casters.
Two new creatures. The origami animal and the cantrimp. Origami animals are animated pieces of paper that do tricks and can fulfill simple tasks while cantrimps are the inevitable result of carelessness with magic. As always these creatures feature full variant rules support and alternate genre information for easy adaptation.
Hedge Mage: A new NPC class, the hedge mage is a self-taught caster who can copy scrolls and make magic items but cannot cast on the fly. Part con-man, part snake-oil salesman and part junk-merchant, these self-taught dabblers can undercut the standard market price for magical equipment so long as reliability isn’t a big sticking point.
Calrith Cazaaar: A new NPC and a living example of the Hedge Mage class. Calrith has a deal for you, even if it is too good to be true.
Gameplay Variants for Low-Level Casting: Skill-based cantrips, bonus cantrips based on ability scores, 0-level casting for Paladins, Blackguards, Assassins and Rangers, 0-level domain spells for Clerics and variant spell-mishap charts let you customize your campaign to suit the
Variant Rules Support: Like all Octavirate products, Octavirate Presents: Simple Tricks and Nonsense provides quick-reference variant rules support for each creature and NPC. In addition to the standard rules for wounds/vitality, defense bonus, armor as damage reduction, modern/3.0 damage reduction, sanity loss, taint, magic rating, spell points, honor and reputation this volume presents spell lists for Mages and Adepts for modern d20 gaming.

86200.name: The Forgotten
86200.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bravery was Khepri’s stock and trade. She was an explorer, a grave robber and a professional. In this world any tomb’s occupant might object to intrusion. Something about this cavern chilled her to the bone. The light scraping of her sandaled feet against the stone walkway echoed into a continuous rustling sound. But no monster or guardian answered the noise. She pressed on.

At the center of chamber she found what she was looking for. The stone was a ruby or red sapphire a foot across set into an obsidian pedestal. Golden flecks sparked within the gem in the light of Khepri’s torch. She paused for a moment. Her imagination turned the gemstone into a great crimson sky filled with golden stars.

Gently she raised the priceless stone from its resting place. There are few things Khepri Satisis would ever regret as deeply.

A soft cracking, like that of an egg being slowly pulled open, rang through the air. This sound was followed by the distinctive ring of sundering stone and shattering glass.

Something was waking up.

The dragons keep their secrets close. Among these are shameful secrets, like the forbidden half-dragonkin. Others are relics from a bygone age. These are the forgotten, failed attempts at breeding a new servitor race as their greatest age drew to a painful close.

Someone or something has awakened both these things in a long-forgotten mountain cavern. Once released, these horrors have no interest in returning to their slumber.

Features:

The Forgotten: Three new hybrids of modern animal and dinosaur, created during the fall of the ancient Dragon Empires. Recently wakened from their sleep, the Ozan, R’zaous and Skored are free to rampage across the world.
Half-Dragonkin Template: Of all the dark secrets of dragonkind, the fact that dragonkin may breed with other species just as pureblooded dragons can is the most closely guarded. The half-dragonkin template allows for halfbreeds of behir, chimera, dragon turtle, dragonne, jabberwock*, pseudodragon and wyvern. Includes example monsters for each dragonkin species.
The Hyeneel: A prototype of the forgotten, this horror fuses the traits of hyenas and electric eels.
New Magic Weapon Abilities: Seven new magic weapon abilities discovered during the unearthing of the forgotten’s tomb: Arrowbane, banishing, chaotic surge, chaotic burst, demolishing, impact and screaming for use in both traditional and modern games.
Multi-genre Support: Background information and story suggestions for quickly adapting the included creatures to modern fantasy, modern science-fiction, post-apocalyptic and space opera settings.
Variant Rules Support: Like all Octavirate products, Octavirate Presents: The Forgotten provides quick-reference variant rules support for each creature Including: wounds/vitality, defense bonus, armor as damage reduction, modern/3.0 damage reduction, sanity loss, taint, magic rating, spell points, honor and reputation.

86201.name: Collectabeast!
86201.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monsters are defined by the generation that observes them. For some, "monster" calls to mind the image of rubbery leviathans and shuffling black-and-white horrors. For others, the word "monster" means dragons, demons, orcs, ogres and all the myriad terrors that lair in the shadows of worlds both contemporary and anachronistic. But for the younger generation, more than ever, monsters are not things of terror.

For to some "monster" means "cute".

Wide-eyed, curious and adorable, a whole new generation of monsters has grown up with a whole new generation of gamers. But this breed of monster is the domain of collectable cards and video games. These creatures have rarely stepped forward into the realm of tabletop gaming.

That is, rarely until now.

Ready or not, here come the Collectabeasts and their rivals, the perpetually mutating Databeasts. They stand ready to invade your campaign world or to establish their own. The role these creatures play is up to you. They might be the core of a fantasy concept that stands to bridge the younger and older gaming generations. They might serve as antagonists in an ongoing campaign to defend the world from an invasion of bizarrely unreal monsters. They can be heroes or villains, pets or companions, natural or unnatural.

The choice, as always, is yours.

Features:

The Collectabeast template turns any monster into a cute collectable-card-style creature ready for combat and mischief. 13 sample collectabeasts demonstrate the nuances of the template and provide ready-to-use beasties for your campaign. Not out to catch "em all? Variant rules allow for the creation of living cartoons, juvenile monsters and more using this template.
The Databeast template creates binary monsters from normal creatures that travel from the world of conceptualized ideas to the physical world and back. 2 sample monsters stand ready to do battle.
The Databeast Hero Class: allows you to play as a databeast. Gain the ability to take on new battle forms as your character progresses and do battle with the aid of your humanoid partner.
Two new items allow you to capture collectabeasts or summon them to do battle.
Three new feats. Gain an extra advantage with announced attacks, absorb your less powerful NPC partners into your body and use your words to assist your companions with these new feats, usable in any campaign.
New Locale: Explore DataCrux, the home plane of the databeasts.
Our biggest Alternate Genre Section Yet provides multiple options for incorporating these monsters into your campaign no matter what setting you are utilizing. As an added bonus, Octavirate Presents Volume 5 is forwards compatible with the upcoming ExorSystems Inc campaign setting.
Giant Level Adjustment Chart: provides base level adjustments for over 600 SRD monsters from both traditional fantasy, psionic and modern settings. Perfect for quickly adapting new monsters to playable collectabeast and databeast forms or simply for playing monster PCs that no one expects.
Variant Rules Support: Like all Octavirate products, Octavirate Presents: Simple Tricks and Nonsense provides quick-reference variant rules support for each creature and NPC. In addition to the standard rules for wounds/vitality, defense bonus, armor as damage reduction, modern/3.0 damage reduction, sanity loss, taint, magic rating, spell points, honor and reputation this volume presents spell lists for Mages and Adepts for modern d20 gaming.

86202.name: Vikings
86202.description:
User Summary: A Norse setting updated for Runequest II.

Publisher Blurb:
A complete setting and background book for RuneQuest II, Vikings brings to life both the history and the myths of the most fierce-some warriors to take to the sea! From character creation to vicious foes to face in battle, Pete Nash leads you through everything you need to start a complete campaign based in Viking society.

86203.description:
Gettysburg: The Bloody Crossroads is the first title in Academy Games' "Fight for the Colours" trilogy of battles, each focusing on a separate day or area of the Battle of Gettysburg during the American Civil War.

The rules will be a cross between the Johnny Reb miniatures ruleset and the game system introduced in Conflict of Heroes by Academy Games. The brigade-level game system relies on unit counters, action cards, and a hex-based map Players can substitute miniatures for the game counters if desired.


Full map of Gettysburg

Bloody Crossroads is a detailed simulation of day one of the Battle of Gettysburg, with twenty scenarios that include fast-playing smaller engagements up to the full northern half of the battle including Culps Hill, the town of Gettysburg, Evergreen Cemetary, Seminary Ridge and more.

Follow on games in the series will include Union in the Balance and High Tide, each focusing on separate areas of the battle including the Round Tops and adjacent areas that could have been used for flanking attacks and calvary fights that might have changed the history of the battle and the war.
86203.name: Bloody Crossroads: Gettysburg Day 1

86204.name: The Hunt
86204.description:
From Introduction:

In The Hunt the characters are doing what they spend much of their time doing: traveling. As the PCs travel through a wood one night, they become embroiled in a local drama. A nearby village has suffered a horrific attack and the peasants, believing a werewolf to be responsible, are out for blood. We have placed this encounter in a mountainous pine forest, but it will work equally well in any climate and any terrain with only minor modifications
to the descriptions.

86205.name: All That Glitters
86205.description:
From Introduction:

In All That Glitters, the characters are at the end of a long trek; the kind of thing heroes undertake all the time. They have come to a small village named Havelock; little more than a market place ringed by a wall, and the party are in need of supplies and a replenishment of their adventuring gear. In any world where heroes travel great distances on quests, this sort of settlement should be very familiar to the characters and they will be glad of the chance to stock up on weapons and rations. In order to make the encounter really seamless, your players should have found themselves tested to the limit just before they reach the market town (the text assumes this to be the case: if you have a different set-up in mind, you will need to modify some of the text). With barely an arrow to share between them, your players should be keen to hurry into Havelock and get shopping! In this encounter however, a simple purchase goes horribly awry as the legality of the PCs' coinage is called into question. They are, in fact, the victims of a scam (more accurately a series of scams) in progress in the market place being perpetrated by a gang of accomplished thieves, calling themselves the Naturals. The crooks intend to take Havelock for thousands of gold coins in a single day and make good their escape before anyone realizes what's going on.

86206.name: Neveredge Falls
86206.description:
From Introduction:

In Neveredge Falls the characters come across an obstacle in the form of a majestic waterfall. As wanderers and adventurers, the PCs will frequently be traveling, so this kind of obstacle should be common. Often, the pressure to complete or continue the main thrust of the campaign means that, when the players set out on these journeys, time passes and they "just arrive" after some bookkeeping by the DM. Critical Hits are designed to fill these moments with opportunities for exciting roleplaying and to force the players to take nothing in the campaign world for granted. In Neveredge Falls, we have kept the descriptions of location and place names to a minimum so that the encounter will fit easily into almost any campaign. Feel free to change any details that don't fit your world. The only really important aspect of the encounter is that the PCs have come to a gigantic waterfall, so all your game world needs is a large river and some high ground! The ridge should extend several hundred miles, to ensure the players don't just opt to go round. If your characters are being chased or hunted, the encounter takes on an added urgency.

86207.name: The Butcher of Bakersville
86207.description:
From Introduction:

In The Butcher of Bakersville the players find themselves relaxing at a tavern on an overnight stop. Meeting a man claiming to be able to help them on the next leg of their journey, they arrange to meet up with him the following day. The man never shows and the characters are drawn into a gruesome mystery. The last person to see him seems to have been Wesney Dott, Bakersville's burly butcher; owner of the Pie Crust and purveyor of fine meat products. What the players don't realize is that for years the innocent looking Pie Crust and its proprietor have been hiding a very dark secret.

86208.name: Mill of Souls
86208.description:
From Introduction:

In the Mill of souls the characters face the most deadly Critical Hit yet. This creepy location, once the workshop of an evil mage, is disturbed as the characters take refuge from a pack of wild beasts. Sensing the life energy of the party, the mill (unaware that its master has long since died) gradually creaks back into motion, beginning the gruesome routines once more. Can the players discover what is happening before they are reduced to spell components for a long-dead necromancer?

86209.name: La France en 2000 Questions
86209.description:
From the game box:
A tour around the France, for ages 8 and above. Cities, regions, history, culture and it is all in 2000 not so hard, not so easy questions. Discover France on a beautiful game board and enjoy the high quality of the question cards in this trivia game for the whole family.
While playing, answer correct to collect amazing souvenirs (points) and bonuses to win the game. First one the collect 100 points is the winner.

86210.name: Tomcat: The F-14 Fighter Simulator
86210.description:
From the back of the package:

Here's a 2600 cartridge that combines the realism of a flight simulator and the action of a fighter game to create an exciting new fighting simulator.

As a naval operator on Blue Water Operations you'll experience all the challenge and danger of Search and Destroy missions. From plane-shaking G-Forces at take off to the intense concentration of a night carrier landing.

Your F-14 cockpit is fully equipped and features displays to monitor enemy fighters, weapons, fuel, wing position and flight paths. Armed with a 20mm cannon, short, medium and long range missiles, the player flies off in search of high speed combat

The dogfights are fierce and if you survive the bogies and have the fuel, you attempt a carrier landing home to a hero's welcome.

86211.name: Trouble Brewing
86211.description:
From Introduction:

The setting of Trouble Brewing is a lonely building capable of teleporting, so the encounter can be located in any terrain you see fit. Curiosity alone should ensure the players don't just opt to go around the peculiar building. As the encounter begins, the PCs are in the middle of some journey or another. As heroes, they are constantly on the move, so Trouble Brewing can be inserted in any of their travels. Wherever they are, it should be a relatively
isolated area so that the presence of a neat building will seem unusual.

86212.name: The Clarion of Hon
86212.description:
From Introduction:

In The Clarion of Hon, the characters stumble across the bloody aftermath of a small skirmish. Orc bodies strewn around the battlefield are numerous but a string of dead adventurers indicate the monsters were victorious. Yet, despite clearly carrying the day on the field of battle, the orcs failed to plunder the bodies as is their wont. Instead, a gleaming horn lies on the floor, begging the players to pick it up. The horn is a strange magical item capable of leading the players into great danger if their curiosity gets the better of them. Little description is given of the surroundings, to make the encounter easy to drop into any fantasy campaign. As written, the encounter takes place in the woods, but the DM can alter this if necessary, it changes nothing about the essence of the encounter.

86213.name: All the Rage
86213.description:
From Introduction:

All the Rage is set in any wooded terrain. As the PCs are en route to whatever their destination may be, they chance upon a bizarre scene. Some of the cutest characters ever to grace the pages of a Critical Hits encounter are doing battle over a valuable crimson dye with mysterious properties! Can the players pick a side and settle the dispute amicably, or will the whole glade be seeing red
before the day is out?

86214.name: Fear at Fiveways
86214.description:
From Introduction:

In Fear at Fiveways, the players suddenly find themselves in a sticky predicament. Without realizing it, they have fallen afoul of the law in a settlement that has had to cope for years with the crippling scourge of rampant crime. The townsfolk's answer to this problem is a draconian penal code, with the sentence for many (seemingly minor) offences being death. The exact nature of the
crime is left to the DM but it can be as trivial as is necessary
to ensure that the PCs are guilty.

86215.name: Scuttler's Cave
86215.description:
From Introduction:

In Scuttler's Cave, the players are undertaking a sea voyage of some kind. As they make their way down the coast, the party encounters what appears to be a ghost ship. In fact, the ship is a disguised pirate vessel and it is loaded with loot. Following the pirates back to their lair, the players find a hidden cave housing treasure and trouble. Can they defeat the buccaneers or will the
party be fed to the sharks of Scuttler's Cave?

86216.name: Stitched In Time
86216.description:
From Introduction:

Stitched in Time can take place in more or less any terrain you see fit, as there are no particular surroundings necessary to make the encounter playable. Curiosity alone should be enough to draw the PCs into the encounter.

86217.name: The Watching Woods
86217.description:
From Introduction:

In The Watching Woods, the party find themselves pitted against an enemy who is nowhere to be seen but from whom there seems to be no escape.

86219.name: Godzilla!
86219.description:
Run back and forth gathering marbles while Godzilla spins around and tries to whack you with his tail! Watch out, if you get knocked over you have to run back home before you can stand up and gather more marbles. Gawo Wowo!

Up to four players each use a hand crank to move their character back and forth on a fixed track, while Godzilla spins in circles sweeping colored marbles around a circular track. Each player tries to grab his or her own color of marble and haul it back to home base. If knocked over by Godzilla's tail, the player looses any marble he is carrying, and has to crank his character back home to stand back up.

86220.name: Beast of Blackwall Canyon
86220.description:
From Introduction:

The Beast of Blackwall Canyon fits easily into any overland wilderness trek, providing a short, violent distraction for your players.

Arriving at the foot of a mighty mountain range, the last stop is a small temple to the Lady Agatha, Guardian of Travelers. The priests of the Lady Agatha organize caravans to travel through the treacherous Blackwall Canyon - the quickest and safest route through the mountain range. It is several days' journey through the narrow file and something sinister lies in it; something that preys on travelers. Large groups can usually fight off attack, but before the priests of the Lady Agatha opened their temple, few survived the journey through Blackwall Canyon. Can the party defend the caravan and make their way through the dark passage in the mountains, or will the mysterious 'Angels' of Blackwall claim yet more souls?

86221.name: Lotus Hunters
86221.description:
From Introduction:

In Lotus Hunters the PCs are employed to seek out the mystical grove of healing lotus plants, fabled to be the key ingredient to many healing potions. The encounter is based around a remote settlement in the foothills of a mountain range, but with some small modifications it can be dropped into any on-going campaign setting. Along the way, the party finds that their exploits inspire both admiration and jealousy and learn the responsibilities that an adventurer must bear. Can they cope with the attentions of their fanatical admirers and those less awestruck by their capabilities, or will the hunt for the strange plants be a quest too far?

86222.name: Mogul Maniac
86222.description:
User summary:

In Mogul maniac you are performing a downhill slalom ski run as fast as possible. Your objective is to get through open and closed gates. Each gate consists of two poles of the same color, red or blue. In open gates the poles are positioned side-by-side, while in closed gates the poles are staggered. You must ski between poles of the same color.

86223.name: Gauntlet (Atari 2600)
86223.description:
From the game's manual:

You are the famous explorer, Sir Richard Wittenbottom. you have discovered an ancient civilization deep in the forest of a mysterious island. Since you are a likeble chap, they have decided to induct you into their council of warriors - but first you must run the GAUNTLET to prove you are worthy of the honor.

You are given three glasses of water. Your task is to use the water to extinguish as many of the ceremonial fires burning at various places within the GAUNTLET as you can, before your water supply runs out. To successfully run the GAUNTLET you must dodge, jump and duck your way through the various obstacles and projectiles while remaining within the confines of the GAUNTLET. Any contact with an obstacle, projectile, or the GAUNTLET, will trip you up and cause you to spill water. You may stop and rest momentarily, but be careful - running the GAUNTLET is thirsty work and you may be tempted to take a drink!

86224.description:
From the publisher:
This is expansion for the "Mees, kes teadis Ussisõnu". This one adds all new and well knows friends from a next book in the series "Rehepapp"

The game adds:
28 new card (8 landscape, 6 owl eggs, 9 enemies, 5 allies)

New rules:

Set-Up - Instead of 4 land tiles, add now all 8 tiles.
Each player gets to start now with one ally card.

Players - Adds 6th and 7th player rules.

Gameplay - won land tile replace with one from the deck.

New Special Cards:

KRATT - same as other enemies, but cannot escape! After wining becomes an ally!

SNOWMAN (land tile) - this one is without mission. Acts same as Meeme card in base game, but it only allows to move to snow and water tiles.
86224.name: Rehepapp

86225.name: Mr. Bounce
86225.description:
Mr. Men Arcade games Pack consists of four separate games:

From the box back

Mr Bounce: strategy and speed are required in this action game. Bounce the ball and break the walls shaped out of Mr Men and Little Miss Characters. As you progress in the game, you'll encounter more bricks and traps. Each character affects your paddle in a different way.

Uses the characters created by Roger Hargreaves. Labelled as suitable for ages 6-10.

86226.name: Majin and the Forsaken Kingdom
86226.description:
User Summary

Majin and the Forsaken Kingdom is an action adventure game for the Xbox 360 and PS3 consoles. The game centres around an unusual pairing: a human thief named Tepejo and a troll-like Majin called Teotl. The two have teamed up to defeat the forces of darkness that have swept across the land and recover Teotl’s memories.

In single-player mode the player controls Tepejo as the duo travel through the kingdom. Elements of stealth action, puzzle solving, platforming, and combat are all interwoven into the quest, which is driven by a strong storyline. The AI teammate is helpful in a number of different situations, and can make battles much easier by allowing Tepejo to eliminate or avoid enemies by utilizing the environment. Although the game starts in a small restricted region, as the player progresses they gain access to more areas and are able to freely explore their environs. Majin appears to be influenced by Ico-like features, but is a distinctly unique game in its own right.

A two player co-op mode is also available.

86227.name: Stealth ATF
86227.description:
The player is in full control of the plane; in other words, the player is in control of taking off from the runway, battling other fighters while airborne, and landing the plane after the battle is over. The fighter is equipped with machine guns and missiles to take out enemy aircraft. Each level has different scenery and varying types of runways; for example, some levels will have a very long runway on solid ground, while others may have a very short one on a carrier out in the ocean. The player must also be aware of the damage the fighter has taken, the amount of missiles it has remaining, and the altitude of the fighter (so it will not crash into the ground).

Missions take place in the potential military hot spots of the late 1980s. These locations are: such as the Middle East, Alaska, and the Pacific.

Source: Wikipedia, "Stealth ATF," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86228.name: Mighty Final Fight
86228.description:
In contrast to the original arcade game, Mighty Final Fight can only be played by a single player. But unlike the SNES ports, all three main characters from the arcade game are present in a single edition. The player can choose between Cody, a street brawler who fights using a self-made martial art combining Karate and Boxing; Guy, an agile master of Ninjutsu; or Haggar, a former professional wrestler. The three main characters retain almost all of their abilities from the arcade game, with some aesthetic differences.

The game introduces a leveling system in which the player gains experience points by defeating enemies. The number of experience points awarded after defeating an enemy is depended on the finishing move used by the player, with stronger moves giving more points. After accumulating a certain amount of experience points, the player will move to the next level, increasing their attack power and maximum vitality. There are six skill levels in total: Cody and Guy both begin the game at the first skill level, while Haggar begins at Level 3. When the player character reaches Level 4, they will receive an additional special attack which can be performed by rapidly pressing the directional pad left or right and the attack button at the same time. The new move the player gets varies between each character: Cody gains the "Tornado Sweep" energy projectile attack, Guy gets the "Tornado Kick", and Haggar's extra move is the "Running Clothesline" (also known as the "Scramble Haggar Press").

Power-up items are also featured, which includes vitality-restoring food items, extra lives, and even additional chances to continue after a game over. Weapons can also be obtained, but unlike the arcade version, the weapon the player can obtain are dependent on the character. Cody will get a knife, Guy can uses a set of shurikens, and Haggar will obtain an over-sized mallet.

The game consists of five stages, as well as two bonus rounds, where the player will encounter child-like counterparts of the Mad Gear members from the original game, including bosses such as Damnd (renamed Thrasher in the English localization), Sodom (Katana), and Abigail. The final boss is a cyborg version of Belger.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mighty Final Fight," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86230.name: Michael Jackson: The Experience (Wii/PS3/Xbox 360)
86230.description:
User Summary:

Michael Jackson: The Experience is a multiplatform dancing game. The game is based around dancing like Jackson, and the soundtrack is comprised of a collection of his songs including “Smooth Criminal” and “Black or White”.

The gameplay varies slightly between platforms, but the general mechanic is the same: while the song is playing, the player must mimic Michael Jackson’s moves on-screen to gain points. For the Wii edition, the game tracks movements through the Wii remote, and it is possible for the player to simply move their arm in the sequence desired by the game. The PS3 and Xbox 360 editions, however, are designed for the Playstation Move and Kinect, respectively, and are based around full body movements.

The Experience also includes a Karaoke feature that scores players on their singing prowess as well. This option can be turned off for those players that simply want to dance. The Wii version does not have karaoke scoring capabilities, but will scroll the words to songs while they are played. The Wii version allows up to four people to dance simultaneously.

The game is also available for the PSP and DS as a rhythm game, which has the players tap along to Jackson’s moves using the buttons or stylus.

86231.name: Farmerama
videogamehonor: 2011 British Academy Game Awards Best Casual/Social Game of the Year Nominee
86231.description:
User Summary:

Farmerama is a browser based online agricultural game in which you get to explore the life of a farmer. You cultivate the land, plant fruit trees, sow and harvest various crops, and raise animals, more of which are available with each level that you gain. You can sell your products to customers or to the game's market. You can also invite online friends who get to be your neighbors and with whom you can trade and exchange gifts.

86232.name: Michael Jackson: The Experience (DS/PSP)
86232.description:
User Summary:

Michael Jackson: The Experience is a multiplatform dancing game. The game is based around dancing like Jackson, and the soundtrack is comprised of a collection of his songs including “Smooth Criminal” and “Black or White”.

Gameplay is different on the PSP and DS than it is on the main releases for the Wii, Xbox 360, and PS3. Players can mimic Jackson’s moves on the portable systems by following the pattern his avatar makes on-screen using the stylus of buttons.

86233.name: My Horse & Me 2
86233.description:
My Horse & Me 2 is an Horse Racing game developed and published by Atari. The Xbox 360 version was released on October 31, 2008.

Source: Wikipedia, "My Horse & Me 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86234.name: Karaoke Revolution Presents American Idol Encore
86234.description:
The PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 versions were the only ones that featured downloadable songs.

In addition to Simon Cowell and Randy Jackson, Paula Abdul's name, voice, and likeness appear in this title for the first time. Ryan Seacrest did not return to voice himself as the host. He is replaced with a lesser known voice actor Johnny Jay to voice as the host of American Idol for this game.

The PlayStation 3 version is the only one that has all downloadable songs available on the PlayStation Network marketplace. The Xbox 360 version has six songs discontinued from the Xbox Live marketplace for undisclosed reasons. On November 18, 2008, the downloadable song "I'll Make Love To You" became available again in the Xbox Live marketplace.

Source: Wikipedia, "Karaoke Revolution", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86235.name: Karaoke Revolution Presents American Idol Encore 2
86235.description:
This is the final Karaoke Revolution game to use the American Idol likeness and features. Konami will no longer use anymore American Idol likeness or license for upcoming future Karaoke Revolution sequels after this game. Songs downloaded from Xbox Live Marketplace for the first Encore game on Xbox 360 are compatible with Encore 2. The previous downloadable songs for the first Encore game on PlayStation 3 downloaded from the PlayStation Store will be automatically imported to Encore 2. Recently for the first time, Konami has released 5 new downloadable songs that never appeared in any of the previous Karaoke Revolution series before. However, these songs originally appeared from one of Konami's other musical game Rock Revolution.

Source: Wikipedia, "Karaoke Revolution", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86236.name: Wheelman
86236.description:
Wheelman is a driving game developed by Midway Studios - Newcastle and published by Ubisoft and Midway Games for the PlayStation 3, Xbox 360 and Microsoft Windows.

The protagonist, Milo Burik (a digitized Vin Diesel), is an undercover agent whose assignment is to work along with a gang in Barcelona planning the biggest heist of their career. He turns out to be one of the most effective weapons in the business.

Source: Wikipedia, "Wheelman", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86237.name: Ridge Racer 6
86237.description:
Like previous Ridge Racer titles, the focus of gameplay is on placing first out of 14 in numerous 3-lap races across several tracks and numerous cars. In most races, the player can earn up to three nitrous boosts by successfully drifting around corners without crashing, which can then be used to give the player a short burst of speed. Some races are labelled as "no-nitrous", which prevent the player from earning any nitrous during the race, though the player can optionally enable nitrous. If the player wins using this option, the race is considered complete, but noted for breaking the no-nitrous rule. Some races are also Duels between the player and a single computer opponent, who is usually equipped with a much better car than the player can select from.

Ridge Racer 6 introduces a career-mode "World Xplorer", a branching-tree arrangement of races in which the player can only attempt races next to a race that has already been successfully completed. The layout of the races in the Xplorer is such that the position of a race will indicate what class of car can be used (horizontal position) and the difficulty of the course (vertical position). Rewards can be obtained by completing certain races or completing all races that enclose an area on the Xplorer, and usually offers new cars but also include additional variations of the tracks (mirroring and reverse) or new branches added to the tree. A player can also engage in quick races and time challenges for any track and car that has been unlocked.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ridge Racer 6", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

86238.name: Rock'n Roll
86238.description:
Um jogo de cartas de ritmo alucinante!

Para vencer é preciso descartar todas as cartas de sua mão. Seja esperto e aproveite para fazer com que os outros comprem cartas e você fique com a mão vazia. Na hora do Rock'n Rooll não deixe que os outros o ultrapassem e descartem as cartas primeiro. Com agilidade e inteligencia você consegue vencer o jogo. Diversão não vai faltar para quem joga Rock'n Roll.



O objetivo do jogo é esvaziar sua mão. Para tal, você deve sempre jogar uma carta com 1 número acima ou 1 abaixo ou com o mesmo número da carta anterior.
Quando entra em jogo a Carta Rock'n Roll, não tem mais ordem de jogo. Joga a carta quem quiser e tem que seguir o comando da Carta Rock'n Roll (jogar apenas cartas vermelhas, apenas pretas, etc.)



A fast-paced cardgame!You need to get rid of all card in your hand to win. Be smart and take the chance to force other players to draw cards while you empty your hand. When it's Rock'n Roll time, do not let the other players discard their cards first. You can win the game allying dexterity with intelligence. Leisure is guaranteed when you play Rock'n Roll.


The goal of the game is to get rid of all your cards. Each player goes in a clockwise direction and needs to play a card with a number that exactly 1 below, the same or 1 higher than the previous card.
When someone plays a Rock'n Roll Card, there's no order of play anymore, each player plays a card following the Rock'n Roll Card rule (only red cards, only black card, etc.).

86239.name: Digimon Story: Lost Evolution
86239.description:
User Summary

Digimon Story: Lost Evolution is the 5th Digimon title released for the DS. The game shares the mechanics of the other DS games in the franchise, having the player take the role of a human aiding the Digimon in the Digiworld. Changes from previous titles include a simplified experience system, the separation of Plant and Insect Digimon into two classes for a total of nine types, and the absence of DNA digivolution specific digimon.

86240.name: Tortured Souls! (Issue 11 - Oct 1986)
86240.description:
From the back cover:

Thinks: "Wonder what's in my Tortured Souls! Issue 11?"

No Pussyfootin': AD&D or Expert adventure for a single thief of 5th-6th level or a single fighter of 7th-9th level. Surely even those loonies at Beast HQ wouldn't have come up with an adventure based on rescuing an old dear's pussy cat from an attic? Looks like they have!

The Sand-Blind: A module for 5-7 5th-6th level characters from the Zhalindor Campaign (a challenging series of independently playable pull-out modules for experienced AD&D players). Nawem Cain has buried his eight sons well, only the wisest of men can penetrate the tomb.

The Tears of the Moon: A module for 7th-8th level characters from the Zhalindor Campaign. The legendary 'Tears of the Moon' can only be collected from the shrine of Khian in Shadulan's Mire, but another race has its own purpose for the shrine and doesn't want any interference...

Necropolis: Where worlds collide; who is waiting on the other side? If you thought the single character modules in issues 7-10 were tough, think again! The four bravest adventurers of Chuza now cross to the plane of Theophagus the God-Eater to face their greatest test yet.

86241.name: Ragnarok: Legend of the Galactic Heroes
boardgamefamily: Legend of the Galactic Heroes fleet battles
86241.description:
This game is operational level wargame based on univers of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes, is Japanese science fiction novel/animation. This game represent invasion Free Planets Alliance by Galactic Empire called "Operation Ragnarok".

Two players move the ｓｔａｒ fleets on the map which covers whole territory of the Free Planets Alliance. The purpose of the Galactic Empire player is the conquest of the alliance. The purpose of the Free planets alliance player is to crush the intention of the Empire.

As a story was so, the ability of the Admiral of Star Fleets influences a movement and a battle. A battle is resolved with the tactics chit choice and the Fire Power CRT. Various fleet tactics in the story are represent by the tactics chit choice.

Scale: 1 turn: 10 days, 1 hex: unknown, 1 unit: about 2000 space ships

86242.name: The Sundered Eagle:  The Theban Tribunal
86242.description:
From the publisher's web site:

Once-proud Constantinople has been ravaged by bloodthirsty Crusaders, and has sunken into depravity and ruin. With the fall of the blessed city, ancient magical bindings maintained by Roman relics of the defeated Empire are now shattered and broken, releasing beasts and demons to roam the land. Tales of unseasonal happenings draw eager hunters and curious Seekers alike. Meanwhile, the magi of the Theban Tribunal and their supernatural patrons devote their efforts to maintaining the peace. They struggle against divisions that mirror the age-old battles of the Titans and Olympian gods, who even now stir among their ancient temples and sanctuaries.

The Sundered Eagle contains full details of the Tribunal of Thebes. The lands of ancient Greece and Asia Minor are the home of epic legends and mighty gods of both Faerie and Magic, while the Byzantine Empire has its own myths. The Theban Tribunal's magi and covenants, who govern themselves according to the democratic institutions of ancient Athens, live among plentiful sites of power. Both mundane and supernatural struggles for supremacy over these lands challenge characters to negotiate a maze of Byzantine schemes. Each faction will have the chance to restore peace and unity to the eastern Empire, under its own banner!

86243.name: UniWar
86243.description:
From the official site:

UniWar is a turn-based strategy game with multiplayer online gameplay for up to eight players as well as a single-player campaign mode. The player's goal in each level is to capture all of his opponent's bases. For each base the player controls, he earns additional credits which can be spent constructing units such as tanks and helicopters.

The game consists of twenty one single-player levels and three armies: Sapians (humans), Titans (machines), and Khralians (aliens). Each army, or race, includes 8 unit types, and each unit type has different degrees of mobility, attack strength, and defense. Special units such as the Sapian Engineer cannot attack or defend but have unique advantages such as the ability to re-program enemy units, effectively converting them to Sapiens unit. Attack is the best form of defence in the game, but in order to succeed at Uniwar players must employ strategies in order to use their limited resources effectively.

86244.name: HELLAS: Princes of the Universe
86244.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The first followup to the original HELLAS Core Rules is coming soon! The blood of kings and gods runs through your veins! Now strike a blow for the future of your world! This book contains:


A dozen killer queens, kings and princes of the universe, complete with intertwining stories and statistics on their home systems and armies.
Customized lifepaths for characters of non-Hellene ancestry, allowing players to create more specialized backgrounds.
Two brand new races -- the ancient and mystical Zorans, and the newly-discovered Pandorans, children of the Atlanteans.
A supplemental Honor system that works alongside the HELLAS Glory system.
Planetary calendars, Zoran deities, a brand new mass combat system, and much more!

86245.name: Highborn
86245.description:
Publisher blurb:

Highborn is a casual, turn-based strategy game for gaming on the go, or for anyone looking for an intelligent, tactical experience without the frenetic play of a traditional real-time strategy game.

Two different types of strategy games combine to offer a casual, yet full-featured game that you can enjoy alone or share with friends. Move your forces around an overhead map to capture points of interest and receive spells and combat support. Then dive into 3D combat to deploy those advantages against an unsuspecting enemy!

All the game play is set against an irreverent take on the classic good-versus-evil tale. Eight wacky heroes banter about, trading dialogue full of miscommunications and outrageous assumptions.

86246.description:
In Drum Roll each player takes over the role of a circus owner in the early 1900s. Each player moves around Europe hiring performers and giving shows.

There are five main categories of performers: the Tamers, the Acrobats, the Bizarre, the Magicians, and the Jugglers. Each of them have different demands the player must fulfill in order to give their best performance.

The requirements, which vary between performers, are Rehearsal, Equipment, Supplies, Costumes, and Promotion. There are three levels of performances that each performer can end up doing in a show: a poor one, a good one, and an outstanding one. The higher the level of performance, the more requirements each performer will have to fulfill in order to achieve it.

The better the performance, the more each player can get out of it. When performers do outstanding performances, the player must choose between getting the maximum amount of benefit out of them, or getting the Prestige Points they are offering. There are also other ways to improve a circus such as trailers, investments, and personnel that will help your performers do their best.
86246.name: Drum Roll
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episodio 4 – Get Bit!, Inventum y Essen 2011
The Spiel at Essen 2011 - Artipia Games
What Did You Play this Week Podcast Thing Week 79

86247.description:
Santa has an opening for Head Reindeer, and he's organized a contest for four reindeer to show off their speed, endurance, and leadership skills as they attempt to lead their team to victory.

In Reindeer Races, you'll control a team of four reindeer, racing along five modular paths to try to get the highest-scoring tiles. You can play any number of matching cards from your hand to move your reindeer, but you should always be on the lookout for opportunities to use action spaces on the paths or even other reindeer to your advantage. Once all of the tiles have been taken from one of the paths, the player who has collected the highest total number of points wins the game.

Ever since that one foggy Christmas Eve, the guy with the red nose has gotten all of the attention, but if you play your cards right, perhaps this is the year we'll be singing about Stuart, the Silver-Nosed Reindeer!
86247.name: Reindeer Races

86248.name: Trash
86248.description: Don't attract flies! Trash is a light trivia guessing game where you have to dig to discover whose trash can you're in! All clues in a trash can lead to a celebrity or character. Uncover a clue, make a guess, but be careful -- if you guess wrong you'll attract a fly. Correct guesses earn points and get rid of nasty flies. The first player to reach 15 points wins!

86251.name: Ordered to Die: The Battle of Ctesiphon 1915
86251.description:
Ordered to Die is a Dennis L. Bishop simulation of the November, 1915, battle of Ctesiphon in Iraq.

A low-to-intermediate complexity, two-player, operational-level game, the players play British and Ottoman sides in the World War One engagement where the British attempted to capture the Ottoman entrenchments at Seimanpak Mayden Muharebesi on the drive to Baghdad. The map scale is two kilometers per hex. Each game turn represents three hours. Units of maneuver for both sides are infantry battalions and regiments, each representing between 250 and 1,000 men; artillery batteries, each with four to six guns; and groups of Arab tribesmen, each representing up to about 500 men.

Components:

* Two-Person or Solitaire
* 4-Page Rules Manual
* 68 5/8" Die-Cut Counters by Lionel Liron
* 22" x 17" Full-Color Map by Tim Allen
* Counter Identification Table

[from the publisher webpage]

86252.name: G1 Jockey 4 2008
86252.description:
User Summary:

G1 Jockey 4 2008 is a very realistic horse racing simulator. It is the sequel of G1 Jockey 4 and G1 Jockey 2007.

You start the game as an inexperienced jockey and work your way up the jockey universe. Your goal is to ultimately become a world class champion by participating in various horse races. You get to breed and train your own horses to become future race winners.

86253.description:
DESCRIPTION
It's Christmas time, but somehow, the spirit of warmth and goodwill has gone astray. The tree IS greener on the other side; and certainly, the presents look more expensive.

So... since your neighbours won't be giving all that lovely loot to you, you're just going to have to take it by stealth.

Recruit an army of elves.
Build up your defenses.
Steal your neighbour's presents before they steal yours!

Each player needs 1 deck of cards. There is no limit to the number of players.

GAME PLAY
Each player starts with 6 cards in front of them face-down, representing 6 presents under 6 branches of their Christmas tree. Each branch comes with a decoration card; these are defenses (e.g. Tinsel barbed wire, Fairy lights electric fence). During their turn, players may play elf cards to form squads, then send the squads of elves to attack their neighbour, attempting to steal their presents.

Elf Defense uses the mechanics of a Magic: the Gathering circle of death to allow any number of players to join in, without significant downtime.

GOAL
A player is eliminated when they have no presents remaining. When there is only one player left, the player who has captured the most presents is the winner.

ADDITIONAL INFO
Elf Defense is an entry for the Christmas print & play competition here: http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/569801/christmas-print-and-p...

Source: designer.
86253.name: Elf Defense

86254.description:
Cinco is a dice-game reminiscent of Bluff/Perudo.
Instead of dice with pips, there are differently colored dragons on each side of the dice. The players roll the dice in secret, then bid increasingly strong sets of dragons, untill one of them lifts the cup. The game differs from bluff mainly in the fact that you lose tokens instead of dice, and in the fact that players can choose to re-roll a number of dice instead of all of them.
86254.name: Cinco

86257.name: DCS: A-10C Warthog
86257.description:
The Publisher Website From the Digital Combat Simulator site:

"DCS: A-10C Warthog" is a PC simulation of the U.S. premier Close Air Support attack aircraft. This is the second aircraft in the DCS series, following DCS: Black Shark, and raises the bar even higher in the DCS series. Warthog brings the most realistic PC simulation of a modern fixed wing combat aircraft in regards to flight dynamics, avionics, sensors, and weapon systems. You also have the option to play Warthog in "Game" mode for a casual game experience. Fly missions in the Caucasus region of the Black Sea against and with a wide array of air, land and sea forces with new and improved intelligence. Create your own missions and campaigns with the included Mission and Campaign Editors, and fly with and against friends online using the included online game browser.

User addition:

Asked about realism, in an interview DCS: A10C producer Matt Wagner says they have been the developer behind the A-10C Desk Top Simulator for the Air National Guard, Active units, and Reserve units of the USA. Part of that deal was to reuse code and data for the production of a 'entertainment' version of the DTS, which, he estimates, is about 95% of the real thing. (Obviously, not everything could be recreated in the game for security reasons.) In the game, the player can look around in the A-10C cockpit and (nearly) every button can be clicked or turned and has the same effect as in real life.

86259.name: Swashbuckler
86259.description:
User Summary

Swashbuckler is a game of sword duels taking place on board a variety of ship settings. The player utilized the keyboard to move back and forth, to move the position of his sword up and down, and to thrust or block. It was considered to be very graphically attractive for its time. The gameplay was pure arcade, as the objective was to achieve a high score with each kill counting for one point.

The human enemies attacked from two directions, approaching the player, who could only attack and defend in one direction at a time, from in front and from behind. The swashbuckler was forced to constantly swivel to meet the attacks; as his score increased, the game sped up and ultimately made defense impossible. After three hits, the player died and the game was over. Small animals such as rats, cobras, and scorpions complicated the challenge, as the player was forced to lower his sword to kill them and therefore expose himself to the attacks of the human enemies.

It was reviewed in the May-June 1982 issue of Computer Gaming World. Editor Russell Sipe noted: "Players of the game at CGW find the graphics to be supurb and the design somewhat unique (however, see Automated Simulations DRAGON'S EYE for another treatment of hi-res swordfighting). However the lack of variety causes the game to become tiresome after a few dozen kills." In the same issue, Swashbuckler was listed as the 15th ranked game (out of 27) in CGW's Reader Input Device #2 with a score of 6.58 out of 9.

86261.name: Geist
86261.description:
User Summary (Sosoluis)

FPS you control a member of special forces that is captured by a medical secret corporation. An experiment extracts your soul from your body, you escape with the possibility to posses the body objects and living forms.

86262.description:
This game is operational level wargame based on Japanese warring states period. Uesugi Kenshin who was the best war commander of this period died in history in April 1578. But, he is the supposition that it didn't die with this game.

Each troop organized by one or more unit.
The game repeats the game turn. Each game turn divided for two player turn. Each player turn include Movement phase, none active side reaction movement phase, Force march phase and combat phase. All unit can move in movement phase, but required pass activity check in reaction and force march phase. Combat result by fire power CRT and two dice.

Victor of the games is decide by victory points. The victory point is provided by the capture of the castle, the removal of the enemy units and unit in Kyoto, is capital of Japan.
86262.name: Kenshin Joraku

86265.name: New Imperialism
86265.description: Territory Acquisition board game. Has New Imperialism theme describing the historical period between 1875 and 1914 when the European great powers as well as new powers such as Japan and the USA were forging far-flung empires in a race for new markets, raw materials, and national prestige. Players recruit and move their units on a world map. Conflict is handled by a quick random method. Victory points are earned by having the most units in Seas and Colonies. Each great power has its own unique abilities and starting set-ups. An Event deck and Empire Deck provide tons of Chrome.

86266.name: Epic Space Empires
86266.description: Just the Epic Stuff!!! Quick playing Card game with a Space Empire theme. Timing and targeting are critical to combat. Use your Fleets to capture planets and defend them. a plethora of Worlds, Races, Governments, Technologies, and Fleet types all have a multitude of special traits and abilities with which to help you defeat your alien rivals.

86267.name: O Tannen-BOOM!
86267.description:
O Tannen-BOOM! is an explosively fun card game for 2-4 players.

Players seek to Build and decorate their own Christmas Tree while blowing the branches off of their opponent's! Best tree (or what is left of one) will go home with the prize!

On a player's turn they may draw cards, play cards (branches of your tree) or play Baubles/Bombs. Players score points for sets of similar Baubles in a row. Many cards also have additional actions that may be played upon adding them to your tree.

Bauble tokens are also your Bomb tokens so you must choose carefully whether to use them in decorating your tree (to gain points) or in blowing up your opponent's (to prevent them from doing the same).

This game was submitted as part of the 2010 Christmas PNP Game Design Contest.

86268.description:
Publisher Blurb:

MORE ’MECHS FOR THE BATTLEFIELD...

You’ve grasped the tactics involved with the additional units and weapons from Total Warfare to defeat your opponents. Now you own Technical Readout: 3085 and want to deploy some of those ’Mechs, vehicles, conventional infantry and Land-Air BattleMechs on your gaming table. Grab your dice and start rolling, because these sheets are for you!

Record Sheets: 3085 contains more than 65 pre-printed ’Mech record sheets that will have players firing autocannons, missiles and PPCs at each other in no time. More than twenty vehicle and conventional infantry sheets bring the excitement of combined-arms game play to any table top. Two ready-to-play scenarios focus on the highlights of this volume, while an extensive Rules Addendum section provides a sneak peak of all the advanced rules options provided in Tactical Operations. Finally, Land-Air BattleMech Quick-Start Rules allow players to instantly field these unique, Star League-era units.
86268.name: Classic Battletech: Record Sheets – 3085

86269.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tearing Down the Walls!

For more than ten years, the Word of Blake’s Jihad has engulfed the states of the Inner Sphere and the invading Clans in chaos and fire. Reeling from attacks on all fronts, realms have fought one another while the Word’s masters built a powerful Protectorate around humanity’s home: Terra. But with the rise of a resourceful rebel leader, Devlin Stone, the collective might of the Great Houses and rival Clans have united for an all-out assault against the Protectorate - one that can only end when humanity’s home is free once again!

Jihad Hot Spots: Terra continues the Jihad plot book series started with Blake Ascending, bringing readers into the latter years of the war between the Word of Blake and the Inner Sphere. Seen from the eyes of those who fight and die in this epic struggle, this book includes articles and intelligence excerpts from across the Inner Sphere, along with additional rules and campaign tracks for both BattleTech campaigns played using the Total Warfare and A Time of War game rules. This book also provides a rare, in-depth look at the Terran system itself, including the history and varied cultures who live on these most revered worlds. Also included are rules and units for the elaborate defense network the Word of Blake unveiled against Stone and his allied Coalition throughout the Protectorate campaign.
86269.name: Classic Battletech: Jihad Hot Spots – Terra

86270.description:
From the box:
The players as part of a tourist group, travel through this fascinating country and discover different cultures, traditions and sights. They visit temples and animal parks and experience the bright and colorful diversity of the land. Tile by tile they collect various symbols to build a pattern called Kolam and the player who creates the longest sequences of these symbols recieve the most victory points.
86270.name: Discover India

86271.name: Corporate B.S.
86271.description:
"Sometimes success has nothing to do with skill." - Anonymous (as quoted on the front of the box)

Object of the Game

The object of the game is to move up the corporate ladder to the penthouse suite and become the Chief Executive Officer of the company.
(from the rules pamphlet)

This game is essentially a roll-and-move race, with event cards and money and other twists to make it a bit more interesting. Instead of rolling the die to determine how far you move, the roll determines which deck of cards you draw from:

1 Job Performance
2 Education and Experience
3 Misfortune
4 Personal Life
5 Connections
6 Fortune

And the card determines your move, usually by giving you a choice. For example, here is a card from the "Personal Life" deck: "You suddenly get hit with two paternity suits. Collect (2) enemychips and move back (3) or pay $2500." Here's one from "Connections": "Your boss' spouse takes a liking to you at a company picnic. Move up (2) or collect $500 and two friendchips."

Most turns you'll have to make a decision as to how to best balance your forward progress with your money, friends, and enemies. Friend chips are awarded for various "friendly" events, and Enemy chips are earned for all the people you had to step on to raise yourself up. Friendchips can be turned into $250 each if you can't otherwise make loan payments, or they can be used to move up one extra space. Enemy chips can be bought off for $500, and you can't enter the CEO's office (and win the game) unless you have more friendchips than enemychips. You also must enter the CEO's office by exact count, so it helps to have friendchips to adjust you movement as needed.

In addition, certain squares landed on indicate that a card from the "Outside Influence" deck is drawn. These cards affect all players. These events may refer to the department indicated on the board spaces. The departments are "Sales," "Accounting," "Data Processing," "Manager," etc. A card from the Outside Influence deck is: "A new simulator increases the productivity of the Technical Department. All technical staff move up (3)."

86272.name: Guide to Rocket Rangers (Savage Worlds)
86272.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Strap on your rocket pack, grab your guns, and take to the skies to help defeat the vile Nazi horde! This supplement introduces rocket packs to the Daring Tales of Adventure high-octane pulp series, letting your heroes blast around the skies in the fashion of The Rocketeer. No additional Savage Worlds supplements or setting (aside from the core rules) are required to use these rules.

86273.name: Perilous Places & Serious Situations
86273.description:
Subtitle: A Savage Worlds Handbook

Publisher Blurb:
This sourcebook contains ways to liven up your games by looking at different locales and the varying dangers they present.

Inside you’ll find rules for expanded arctic and desert survival, the dangers of collapsing tunnels and stampedes, fighting atop rooftops, crumbling cliffs, tall columns, rope bridges, underwater, and on vertical surfaces, the hazards of stormy nights and swamps, and expanded traps.

86274.name: BZFlag
86274.description:
User Summary

BZFlag is an open-source tank warfare game. You control (with either mouse or keyboard) a tank that can jump, and navigate it through hundreds of user-generated levels that have many potential variations, both in layout and variables that can be toggled for a specific round. Collect weapons and power-ups ("flags") as you work alone or in a team to achieve your objectives. Gameplay modes include free for all, team free for all, capture the flag, rabbit hunt, king of the hill, and hold the flag. Being able to use the radar to quickly understand the situation is key to avoiding enemy fire and locking in on your target.

BZFlag has an active development and user community, and is free to download and play, either locally or on one of the many hosted servers.

86275.description:
Kwintie is a strategical building game for 2 players. The objective of the game is to build a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row of 5 square blocks.

The blocks that the players play with have the dimensions of 1 x 1 x 2. The blocks must be placed on a board consisting of a single row of 9 squares, or on top of one another. Blocks from one colour may not touch with their 1 x 1 sides (in other words, two pieces of one colour may not form a vertical or horizontal row that is four cubes long). The first player to get 5 in a Row is the winner. If a player cannot move anymore, then he loses. For balancing purposes, the first move of the first player may not be touch the center field.
86275.name: Kwintie

86276.name: HELLAS: Map of the Known Worlds
86276.description:
From the publisher:

A layered PDF of the map of the known worlds of HELLAS now presented here for the low, low price of free!

86277.name: HELLAS: Sample Characters
86277.description:
From the publisher:

A group of sample characters for use with the HELLAS: Worlds of Sun and Stone Role-playing game. Created originally for the 2010 Gencon HELLAS games the characters are now presented here for the low, low price of free

86278.name: Food for Thought
86278.description:
From the publisher:

The survivors are welcomed into a small town, but quickly discover that the food they are being served is not animal meat, or even human meat . . . but something far worse.

Can they escape before the town's terrible secret destroys them all?

War of the Dead: Food for Thought takes place between Chapter 1 and Chapter 2, or can be used as a one-shot at any convention.

86280.name: The Survivors
86280.description:
From the publisher:

Presented are 10 characters, 5 male characters and 5 female characters, for use in the War of the Dead for Pinnacle Entertainment's Savage Worlds role-playing game.

Each character is built as a Novice ranked character with no Experience Points, and is perfect for use in any convention game, allowing the GM to mix-and-match to form a balanced player-group.

But what if you aren't running a convention game? No problem! The characters can also be used as new Allies for an already established player-group.

Download them today and begin your fight in the war for survival . . . the War of the Dead!

86281.name: Outbreak at Hopewell
86281.description:
From the publisher:

In desperate need of food and supplies, the survivors are welcomed into a small community. But when a new type of horror infects the neighborhood, can they survive long enough to escape?

War of the Dead: Outbreak at Hopewell, a prelude to War of the Dead: Chapter Two.

86283.name: Values of Survival
86283.description:
From the publisher:

Written by the Savage Worlds forum's own Emiricol, Values of Survival draws inspiration from games such as Evil Hat Productions' FATE system. It adds a narrative layer to your War of the Dead campaign, focusing on those aspects that define each character as a unique individual.

Released with permission from Evil Hat Productions, War of the Dead: Values of Survival is available as a free campaign add-on.

86284.name: The Dead of Night
86284.description:
From the publisher:

In a homage to Night of the Living Dead . . . with a twist . . . the characters are trapped in an abandoned farm house as a horde of Living Dead surrounds their temporary refuge.

Can the survivors escape before the Living Dead consume them?

War of the Dead: The Dead of Night takes place between Chapter 1 and Chapter 2, or can be used as a one-shot at any convention.

86285.name: The Cult of Bane
86285.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

A level 1 side adventure for 4th edition D&D characters.

The "A Dungeon Dash" series of side adventures by Kurt Sparkuhl are FREE products designed to enhance your 4th edition D&D campaign. Each Dash takes only 10 minutes or less to read through, and usually clocks about 3-5 hours of play time. With some additional preparation, each Dungeon Dash can serve as the foundation for a larger highly detailed adventure.

Every Dungeon Dash includes:

New custom monsters
New traps/hazards/puzzles
A detailed map and descriptions of every encounter
Treasure and reward guidelines
Example story hooks to blend the adventure into your campaign.

86286.name: Malagai
86286.description:
From the manual of the game:

You are Harrington 'Harry' Crag, commander of the starship "Endless Search".

You have landed on a MALAGAI starbase to make emergency repairs to your ship. The repairs are now complete but the MALAGAI are holding you for ransom...they need the secrets of your advanced civilization!!! You are allowed to roam about the ship as long as you are not away from your compartment too long and you do not try to escape. Your ship is located outside a series of three airlocks. The key to each airlock is held by one of the MALAGAI. You must catch the MALAGAI in the order shown at the top of the screen and get to the airlock before being captured. If you take too long, or catch the wrong MALAGAI, returning to your compartment will make the MALAGAI friendly again and give you another chance for escape.

MALAGAI is a game that offers different playing speeds and strategy levels and is sure to challenge your mind and skills. Get ready to enjoy the action!

86287.name: Battlegrounds: RPG Edition
rpgpodcastepisode: Season 1 Episode 8 - Kung Fu or No KungFu
86287.description:
About Battlegrounds (aka BRPG)
Battlegrounds is a commercially-sold virtual tabletop program that allows people to play role playing games (and now boardgames, wargames, card games, and dice games!) in real-time over the Internet (peer-to-peer), on a LAN, or offline. Battlegrounds is also available via monthly subscriptions, so users have the option to either buy or "rent" licenses.

Features (from publisher's website)

• Easy to learn and use

• Cross-platform (Windows & Mac OS X)

• Supports play in any genre, with any RPG rules system

• In addition to RPGs, Battlegrounds can also be used to play many boardgames & wargames

• The perfect solution for gaming groups where one or more members have moved away

• Full-screen maps, high-resolution tokens, and a user interface that hides away when you don’t need it, to avoid on-screen clutter and heighten the immersion factor

• Easily add your own artwork and maps to the program

• Display visual aids and play music or sound effects to enhance the mood

• Dynamic Fog-of-War feature automatically reveals the map as the party explores, taking into account light sources and any special vision the characters may have

• An incredibly-powerful dice roller that supports most RPG game mechanics, yet requires absolutely no scripting

• Built-in text chat with support for group or private chat, in-character and out-of-character chat, chat aliases, chat macros, an exportable Chat Log, and more

• A highly-configurable Turn Sequencer ensures that everyone always knows whose turn it is (or if their turn is coming up), and also keeps track of important character stats

• Support for card decks, including custom card deck creation

• A token-swapping feature lets you easily switch token poses (standing, prone, mounted, etc), or “flip” virtual counters

• Pop-up character portraits, range measuring, a full assortment of drawing tools, and much more round out the feature set

• Ideal for use with a projector or HDTV in face-to-face game sessions

• Use Battlegrounds to generate awesome visuals for your play-by-post or play-by-email games

• If you already use a mapping program like Dundjinni or Campaign Cartographer, you can save time and money by not having to print out your large, full-color battlemaps

• A developer who listens to user feedback, and a helpful, friendly, and rapidly-growing user community

• A free, full-featured Demo is available for download, so you can try out the software before you buy

• Many free artpacks are available for download, and commercial artpacks are available to further enhance your games

• Many free digital game conversions are available for download, and a growing selection of commercial Game Boxes are also available

86288.name: Dance Central
videogamehonor: 2010 Game Critics Best of Show Nominee
2010 Game Critics Best Social/Casual/Puzzle Game of the Year Nominee
2010 Game Critics Most Original Game of the Year Winner
2011 British Academy Game Awards Best Family/Children's Game of the Year Nominee
2011 D.I.C.E. Best Gameplay Engineering of the Year Nominee
2011 D.I.C.E. Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2011 D.I.C.E. Family Game of the Year Winner
2011 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
86288.description:
User Summary:

Dance Central is a rhythm game for the Xbox 360 that uses the Kinect peripheral. The game has players emulate a number of dance moves by moving their bodies, and the Kinect scans their movements to rate their skill level. Performing a number of successful moves in sequence will build up a multiplier that gives more points for continued successes. Dance Central has a 5 star scoring system similar to that of the Rock Band and Guitar Hero series.

The game features three play modes: Break It Down, Perform It!, and Dance Battle. Each mode offers different gameplay options to the player. Furthermore, Dance Central includes a Workout mode that records calories burned each session.

There are 32 songs included in the game broken down into 7 difficulty levels. Like Rock Band and Guitar Hero, additional songs will be available for download through a Music Store, but these songs will be priced higher than previous games’ content due to the added effort required in choreographing the songs.

86289.name: Love
86289.description:
User Summary

Love is a sci-fi MMO created by Eskil Steenberg that is free to download. Players take the roles of scavengers on a small planet that must work together with other scavengers to survive. The game is very cooperation oriented, and players work together as tribes gathering resources and tokens that improve the abilities and equipment of everyone in the village.

There are five other tribes that act as rivals for resources. These tribes will attack your village if they are provoked, and will rebuild if their village is destroyed. The art style in Love has an impressionist feel to it which marks the images with a unique display. The game is programmed using procedural algorithms that react to actions by players, making the game effectively unscripted.

86290.name: Knowledge Arcana (Issue 8  - Winter 2006)
86290.description:
Issue 8 of Knowledge Arcana

Cover art by Steve Musgrave

86291.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice (Issue 2  - Spring 1979)
86291.description:
From contents page:

Troll Talk / Editorial: Ken St. Andre

On Trolls...and Others / Article: Poul Anderson

Seven Ayes / Mini-Solo Dungeon: Ken St. Andre

Letters

It Aint Easy / Article: Bob Liddil

Heroic Fantasy / Feature: Ken St. Andre

Flying Buffalo's DM Dungeons / Review: Martin Schlesinger

The Fair, The Four, and The Foolish / Fiction: Charles de Lint

Watership Down From The Bottom Up / Article: Terry Ballard

Arcane Graffitti / News, Clues and Reviews

Basic Bibliography for Dungeon Designers / Article: Ken St. Andre

The Basics of T&T Combat / Article: Liz Danforth and Ugly John Carver

Yggdrasil / Cartoon: Brian McCrary

crystallized: words by Lee Russell, unicorns by Victoria Poyser

86292.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice (Issue 1  - Winter 1978)
86292.description:
From the contents page:

Troll Talk: Editorial - Ken St. Andre

Kingmaker: Mini-Solo Dungeon - Michael Stackpole

Firearms in T&T: Ken St. Andre & Tommie Williams

Tunnel Visions - Ugly John Carver & Liz Danforth

Solo Dungeon Review - Martin Schlesinger

Know Your Foe 101 - Michael Stackpole

Brother To Ghosts - Robert E Vardeman

Weapon Experience - Gregory Courter

Letters & Classifieds

Heroic Fantasy - Ken St. Andre

Midnight Sun - Karl Edward Wagner

86293.description:
Gameplay:

A two player game in which each player commands a group of robots with special abilities. Some robots fly, some explode, some push, some create clones, etc. For three rounds each player will simultaneously select up to three robots to charge onto the game board from a dock that attaches to one edge of a game board. The robots are given a power token which specifies how many spaces it can move and a priority token which specifies when a robot will move. If you've successfully outguessed your opponent, you'll be able to claim the center of the board and score more points. The team that has scored the most points at the end of three rounds is the winner.

From the rules:

By the year 2534, inefficient, unreliable human players of team sports have been replaced by machines, maximizing enjoyment for all. To take advantage of the machines’ capabilities, new Robosports have been invented.

The third most popular sport on planet Earth after SPACECAR racing and Clone Professional Wrestling is RoboUltimateMechaBattleLeague, where the controllers try to program their team of robots to seize the middle of the playing field in three rounds of exciting robotic combat. To win a RUMBL, you must carefully choose among the special abilities of your robots, place them for maximum impact, anticipate your opponent’s moves, and ration your team’s power strategically. If you can do all this, you can rule the RUMBL!
86293.name: R.U.M.B.L.

86294.name: Spanky's Quest
86294.description:
