Running out of food, ammo, or fuel could be disastrous, as infection sets in, leading to madness and eventual transformation into a zombie!

86486.name: Delta Force 2
86486.description:
from back of the box

you are part of the best kept secret of the US army: the special elite forces better known under the name delta force. these units where brought to life to fight terrorism anywhere in the world. are you ready for the battle?

86487.name: Nightmare Creatures
86487.description:
from back of the box

the scientiest adam crowley has created monsters that made the city london their battling ground. take ignatius or nadia en fight against them in this 3d scout en fight game: maybe even the most horrofiing game ever!

86488.name: Quetzalcoatl
86488.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Les Aztèques vénéraient Quetzalcoatl, le Serpent à Plumes, terrible dieu du soleil et du sang.

Celui-ci a accordé une forme d'immortalité à ses prêtres momifiés : en étant exposé au soleil, et en buvant deux litres de sang, ils s'éveillent, prêts à instaurer le règne de Quetzalcoatl sur Terre!


User Translation from French:

The Aztecs venerated Quetzalcoatl, the Feathered Serpent, terrible god of sun and blood.

He has granted a form of immortality to his mummified priests: upon being exposed to sunlight, and drinking two litres of blood, they arise, ready to establish the reign of Quetzalcoatl on Earth!

86489.name: Sept JdR
86489.description:
From the Designer's Website:

Sept jeux de rôles sur une seule page.


User Translation from French:

Seven role-playing games on only one page.


User Summary:

This is Phillipe Tromeur's entry for the Casus NO forum RPG contest of July 2007 (7/07) which had the theme of "Seven". He manages to squeeze seven complete (and legible!) sets of rules onto one side of A4 page, each with a different genre.

86491.name: Academy of Secrets
86491.description:
Publisher blurb:

Every year the professors at the Acadamae, Korvosa prestigious school of the arcane arts, hosts the Breaching Festival, where the city's most skilled infiltrators are invited to try and infiltrate the school, testing their luck against the university's students, otherworldly guardians, and deadly traps for a chance at a fortune in gold and magical treasure. This year, your heroes number among those invited to test the defenses of a new generation of Acadamae apprentices, but something more than the promise of fame and riches calls out from the university's deepest sanctum, and this year's festival promises to be the deadliest trial the school has ever known!

Academy of Secrets is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for 13th-level characters. It features a massive magical university teeming with sorcerous traps, weird puzzles, diabolical monsters, and countless students and professors trapped in a web of arcane deceit. Academy of Secrets also includes a new monster and details on Korvosa's Academae, Golarion's most famous school of magic, noted in Pathfinder Campaign Setting: Guide to Korvosa and the Curse of the Crimson Throne Adventure Path, but thoroughly detailed here for the first time.

86493.name: Sbronzopoli
86493.description: Sbronzopoli (where "sbronza" means to get plastered) is an alcoholic roll-and-move party game for adults, inspired by Monopoly. Here you move your pawn towards the goal, drinking at almost each step of your path.

86496.name: 2012: The Day of Fallout – Commander
86496.description:
2012: The Day of Fallout - Commander
Free, tactical board game for 2 players (print and play)

Lead one of two armies: Human Section 8 and Arkanian alien race. Fight for domination over the Last District on Earth.

Section 8 is last hope of mankind, has powerful offensive units. Arkanians - insectoid invaders form space with heavily armoured units trying to take over the earth.

Phases of game:
- draw to 3 cards on hand
- recruit units
- realize special missions
- move units on board
- attack
- Victory Points counting

Victory is achieved by:
- collecting victory point's
- destruction of all enemy unit's on board
- winning three of the four opponent fields (starting field's)

Game in Polish and English language version.

86499.name: Rollespilsmagasinet Fønix (Issue 26 - September 1999)
rpgpublisher: Sleipner - Landsforeningen af rolle- og konfliktspillere i Danmark
86499.description:
Index:
1 Forside (Front page): Jørgen Bech Pedersen
3 Leder (Editorial): Jesper Bøje
5 Indhol (Index)
6 Nyheder (News): Dennis Larsen
7 Den perfekte rollespilssession (The PRG session): Mikkel Bækgaard
10 The Settlers of Catan: Mikkel Bækgaard
12 Duerne Flyver - Et Call of Cthulhu-scenarie (The pigeons are flying - A Call of Cthulhu adventure): Nicholas Demodoff
20 Almindeligheder (Commons): Mads Lunau
22 Kalenderen (The calendar): Rune Lippert
24 Konkurrencen (The competition): Mads Lunau
24 Kort nyt (Card news): Mads Lunau
26 Interview med en psykolog (Interview with a psychologist)
28 Hvordan spiller man sindsyg i rollespil (How to play insane in an RPG): Andreas Ravn Skovse
30 Er alle vampyrer blege? (Are all vampires pale?): Natural Born Holmers
32 Bliiver man sindsyg af at spille rollespil? (Will RPGs turn you insane?): Jesper Wøldiche
35 Rollespillets historie (History of the RPGs): Réne Toft
37 Werewolf: The Dark Ages (Review): Andreas Ravn Skovse
38 Wraith: The Great War (Review): Jesper Wøldiche
39 Dragonlance Classics 15th Anniversary Edition (Review): Jesper Bøje
40 Rolemaster Fantasy Role Playing (Review): Søren Ruskjær
40 Rettelse (Corrections): Brian Graversen
42 Næste nummer & Abonnement (Next issue & subscription)
44 Bagside (Rear page)

86001.name: Deathtrap Dungeon!
86001.description:
From the text:
You awaken to the sound of the heavy iron door slamming shut. Your worst fear has been realized: you have been thrown into the DEATHTRAP DUNGEON!

User Summary:
This is game is a dungeon crawl using the Parsely system. It features the standard dungeon crawl tropes and makes good use of the Parsely mechanics.

86002.name: Lords of Chaos Expansion Kit 1
86002.description:
User Summary

This added two scanrios to the basic game: The Islands of Iris and Tombs of the Undead.

boardgamehonor: 2011 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee
86003.description:
Aether Captains is a steampunk themed, scenario-based, asymmetric board game for 1-6 players.

One player commands the mighty naval zeppelins of the Grand Compact: Dauntless and Dominion. As Commander, you have been tasked by the Emperor to defend the Grand Compact and Arkady from the merciless sky pirates. With your staunch crew of steam welders, engineers, navigators and gunners, you fly with honor to confront the pirates threatening Arkady.

The remaining players command waves of attacking sky pirates, each with their own unique objectives which may pit them against any player when it results in the greatest profit for themselves. Infamous and feared, you have risen through the cutthroat cadres to become a War Captain. You swear to never rest until you control the skies and the Grand Compact falls!
86003.name: Aether Captains
boardgamepodcastepisode: Gaming Nonsense Uncensored Ep 035: Aether Captains preview with Alex from MAGE Compay

86005.name: Teenage Queen
86005.description:
User Summary

Teenage Queen is a strip poker game. The player must defeat the computer in order to gradually undress his opponent, with a surprising twist at the end.

The game interface and animations are digitized hand drawings by Jocelyn Valais, and the Amiga and Atari ports of the game feature digitized sound clips.

86006.name: Hinkel & Stein
86006.description:
This game is set in the old days, when Gaul tribes – and Romans, too – were engaged into some special sport: Hinkel & Stein.

Two to four players place stones out of four types of (artificial) stones onto a see-saw scale. The "Chief" player (a "job" that rotates each round) determines whether the lighter or the heavier side of the scale will be declared the winning side at the end of this round.

During a round, each player places one of their stones onto one of four spaces at the ends of the see-saw. The order of the players is determined by the Chief. Before placing a stone, each player may raise the prize to be won (the currency in this game are wooden discs - "wheels") in the middle of the game or take one disc. Taking a disc automatically excludes you from winning any discs at the end of the round. Special abilities of the different kinds of stones and the fact that all players play each type of stone over several matches makes this a rather heavy tactical wagering game.

English rules for 2-4 players will soon be available on the Chili Spiele website as well as here on BGG.

86007.name: Fatal Inertia
86007.description:
User summary:

Fatal Inertia is set in the mid 22nd century. Control of entertainment lies in the hands of a few huge corporations which have created a sporting event that draws from the combined disciplines of rally racing, demolition derby and tactical air warfare.

In this brave new world of combat racing, you will have the opportunity to pilot four different types of gravity-defying craft. You will also have a plethora of unconventional, non-lethal, magnetic weapons at your disposal.

There are six different racing venues that are divided into fifty-one courses. Feel the rush of racing at lightning speeds and of delivering a punch of magnetic blasts at your opponents.

86008.description:
Catan Geographies: Austria, a.k.a. Die Siedler von Catan: Österreich Edition, is the fourth in a series of regional map expansions for the venerable Settlers of Catan line.

The rules of the Austria Edition are closely to those of standard Catan, with a few departures to keep things interesting. Players may build cities only in the round intersections denoting actual cities. Because some of the cities are only one hexside apart, the spacing rule requiring two roads between settlements is not in effect. Roads can be built only on the printed spaces; when a space is printed in red, then this road is equal to a trading-harbor (3:1 trading)
86008.name: Catan Geographies: Austria

86009.name: Silvervine Games Core Rulebook and Cyrus Worldbook
86009.description:
from the back of the book

Who Do You Want To Play Today?
In a lot of gaming systems that question gets answered for you, but not here. Silvervine is all about you and the character you want to play. Designed to let you build your character and define the way EVERYTHING about them works, the system encourages collaborative play and supports the Game Master and players with a simple to run, easy to improvise, and fun system.

Character Creation
Character creation in Silvervine works on a point buy system. Buy skills, powers, raise your character’s attributes, and get just the right mix for your character concept.

Thematics
You’ve got total control of how and why your character’s stuff works. When you activate your flight power do Dragon Wings grow from your back, erupting in mystic flame? Do you rev up your steampowered jetpack and erupt into the sky? It’s all in your hands! Is your sword forged from a single dragonscale, is your mace a giant wrench, is your handgun embedded in your metallic arm? That’s up to you!

Cinematics
Just like you have control over the thematics of your powers and equipment, you have cinematic control of your actions. You get to say what happens and how. Your actions are in your descriptions and are as incredible as you want them to be.

Narrative
Silvervine is about stories - the story of the characters, the story the Game Master is crafting, and the collaborative space they come together in. Shared narrative ties it all together and makes the fun. The game system keeps it balanced and fun but the story makes it yours.

86010.name: Live and Let Die
86010.description:
User Summary

"Live and Let Die" is a computer game inspired by the speedboat chase sequence of the James Bond movie.

The game includes 4 missions (Sahara, the Arctic and New Orleans and a practice circuit). The player pilots a speedboat armed with a machine gun and rockets along a river, dodging obstacles like mines or rocks, destroying enemy boats and planes, and collecting fuel canisters.

86011.name: Dragoneer's Aria
86011.description:
User summary:

Dragoneer's Aria is a turn based RPG in which you play the role of Valen Kesslar, a young man about to become a Dragoon. On your day of graduation from the Academy, an evil Black Dragon appears and causes destruction and sorrow. Although it is repelled, it injures Elemental Water Dragon in the process. It is now up to you to investigate the origin of the black Dragon, while defending all six Elemental Dragons from it.

There are three additional playable characters in the game in addition to Valen Kesslar. Euphe, a female Empath, Mary Murphy captain of a pirate ship and Ruslan L'avelith guardian of the Elemental Earth Dragon.

At your disposal you have rings and necklaces to which you can attach jewels, and thus perform various magical elemental attacks. Certain elemental dragon orbs that you may find, will provide you with more powerful elemental attacks.

86012.description:
Latest Addition of the Bohnanza-series for 2-6 players. Only playable with Ladybohn: Manche mögen's heiss!
The set consist of 33 new cards:
8 babies
24 special male cards (2 of each kind)
1 counter card

The cards can be used to exchange and "spice-up" the base game as the male beans (such as the Chauvinist Pig or Slacker) bear conditions on them which can alter the game play.
2 regular cards are replaced with "mama's beans".
For Example: The Chauvinist Pig (a Saubohne, of course) only lets the lady beans be below the bean field. The metrosexual lets them get up front immediately.
The Bachelor discards all babies to the discard pile.
Those cards can really alter the gameplay.

...and then there's the Attack of the Little Rascals!
86012.name: Mutterböhnchen

86013.name: Minotaurus
86013.description:
Players must prove their adeptness at somersaulting bulls. They do that by performing the somersault in five steps.

Left and right horn stones of varying colours and values are used in a type of Memory game to collect matching pairs of horns. These pairs symbolise the height of the somersault. Higher values mean greater skill.

Players can challenge each other by trying to throw a ring over one of the horns of a bull sculpture.

Victory goes to the player who has the highest jumps at the end of the game.

Content of the box:

50 playing stones and 1 horn sculpture made of THETA stone
one leather ring
one rulebook




Source : translated from publisher's website

86015.name: L'Anneau de Zengara
86015.description:
User Summary

L'Anneau de Zengara ("The Ring of Zengara") is a French roleplaying game developed by Hervé lange. It takes place in the same universe as Fer & Flamme and uses the same ruleset (in fact, players can import characters from Fer & Flamme into this game). L'Anneau de Zengara tells the story of an adventurer looking to get rid of a cursed magic ring. His journey leads him to explore the Tower of Shadar the Thief in the town of Zengara, encounter allies and enemies, and free a mysterious princess.

The game uses a streamlined version of the Fer & Flamme engine: players still manage their adventurer (and later in the game, their party) using icons but the display has been improved, leaving more room for graphics and descriptive text.
